syntaxArray.Params:
unit: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - Unit whose inventory should be saved
input: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) in format:

* 1: [Namespace](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Namespace), [Group](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Group) or [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - Target where the loadout is stored

* 2: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Loadout name
params: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - (Optional, default [ ]) Custom parameters stored with the loadout
delete: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - (Optional, default [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false)) Whether or not to delete the loadout

bis_fnc_randomint.name: BIS_fnc_randomInt
bis_fnc_randomint.description:
Returns a random integer between the two passed numbers (inclusive). The order of parameters doesn't matter: it can be 
```sqf
[min, max]
```
 or 
```sqf
[max, min]
```
.

syntaxArray.Params:
min: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - minimum value, included
max: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - maximum value, included

bis_fnc_createruin.name: BIS_fnc_createRuin
bis_fnc_createruin.description: Create a building ruin and hide the original object.

syntaxArray.Params: building: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - building to "destroy"

examples:
```sqf
aBuilding [call](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/call) BIS_fnc_createRuin;
```

```sqf
*// will destroy every building in a 50m radius around the player*
{ _x [call](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/call) BIS_fnc_createRuin; } [forEach](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/forEach) ([player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player) [nearObjects](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/nearObjects) ["House", 50]);
```

syntaxArray.Params:
timeline: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - The timeline object
initPosition: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - (Optional, default 
```sqf
timeline [getVariable](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/getVariable) ["Pos", 0.0]
```
) Initial position
length: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - (Optional, default 	
```sqf
timeline [getVariable](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/getVariable) ["Length", 10.0]
```
) Length
playRate: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - (Optional, default 
```sqf
timeline [getVariable](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/getVariable) ["PlayRate", 1.0]
```
) Play rate
loop: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - (Optional, default 
```sqf
timeline [getVariable](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/getVariable) ["Loop", false]
```
) [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) - loop enabled, [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false) - loop disabled
reverse: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - (Optional, default 
```sqf
timeline [getVariable](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/getVariable) ["Reverse", false]
```
) [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) - reverse, [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false) - Do not reverse
playOnStart: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - (Optional, default 
```sqf
timeline [getVariable](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/getVariable) ["PlayFromStart", false]
```
) [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) - play at scenario start, [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false) - Do not play at scenario start
destroyWhenFinished: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - (Optional, default 
```sqf
timeline [getVariable](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/getVariable) ["DestroyWhenFinished", false]
```
) [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) - Destroy when done , [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false) - Do not destroy when done

bis_fnc_bitwiseand.name: BIS_fnc_bitwiseAND
bis_fnc_bitwiseand.description:
Performs bitwise AND operation on two decimal or hexadecimal unsigned 24 bit integers (Hexadecimal number representation is simply auto-converted into decimal by the engine)
**Limitations**:
Due to various limitations of the Real Virtuality engine this function is 
intended to work with unsigned 24 bit integers only. This means that the 
supported range is 2^0...2^24 (1...16777216)

syntaxArray.Params:
num1: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - decimal or hexadecimal unsigned 24 bit integer
num2: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - decimal or hexadecimal unsigned 24 bit integer

bis_fnc_getcfg.name: BIS_fnc_getCfg
bis_fnc_getcfg.description:
Smart-return config (extension for BIS_fnc_getCfgXXXX functions).
Can by called 2 ways:

bis_fnc_bitwisenot.name: BIS_fnc_bitwiseNOT
bis_fnc_bitwisenot.description:
Performs bitwise NOT operation on decimal or hexadecimal unsigned 24 bit integer (Hexadecimal number representation is simply auto-converted into decimal by the engine)
**Limitations**:
Due to various limitations of the Real Virtuality engine this function is 
intended to work with unsigned 24 bit integers only. This means that the 
supported range is 2^0...2^24 (1...16777216)

syntaxArray.Params: num: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - decimal or hexadecimal unsigned 24 bit integer
objOrGrp: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) or [Group](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Group)

bis_fnc_synchronizedobjectsqueue.name: BIS_fnc_synchronizedObjectsQueue
bis_fnc_synchronizedobjectsqueue.description:
/*
	Author: Jiri Wainar

	Description:
	Return sequence of all synchronized objects forming either line or circle.

	Parameter(s):
		0: OBJECT - starting object
		1: STRING or ARRAY of STRINGs (Optional) - object types that are considered
		2: BOOL (Optional) - class filter uses exact match
			true (default): objects need to match exectly one of the filter classes
			false: exact match is not required, objects can inherit from one of the listed classes
		3: NUMBER (Optional) - expected connection shape
			0 (default): none, can be either line or circle
			1: line expected
			2: circle expected

	Returns:
	ARRAY of OBJECTs or empty ARRAY if error is encountered

	Errors:
		* There are more then 2 objects matching class filter connected.
		* Circle is required but closing connection is not detected.

	Example:
	[_start,["ModuleToWAreaVertex_F","ModuleToWAreaOptions_F"],true,0] call bis_fnc_synchronizedObjectsQueue;
*/> 🏗Placeholder description extracted from the function header by [BIS_fnc_exportFunctionsToWiki](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/BIS_fnc_exportFunctionsToWiki).

"config" - copy the objects table to clipboard
"screenshots" - create objects one by one and take their screenshot. Works only on "[Render](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Render_Worlds)" terrain.
"screenshotsTest" - create objects one by one without taking screen (to verify everything is ok)

bis_fnc_setdate.name: BIS_fnc_setDate
bis_fnc_setdate.description: Instantly set date and share it across network with optional transition effect. [](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/File:BIS_fnc_setDate.jpg)

syntaxArray.Params:
value: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) or [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)


* [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Hours to skip. To show exactly *30 minutes later* put 
```sqf
30/60
```
. 
```sqf
0.5
```
 will show *29 minutes later*


* [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) in format [Date](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Date) - Date
global: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - (Optional, default [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true)) [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) for global execution
transition: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) (Optional, default [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false)) [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) to show a transition effect instead of an immediate skip

examples:
```sqf
[[2035, 12, 31, 23, 59], [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true), [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true)] [call](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/call) BIS_fnc_setDate;
```

```sqf
[4, [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true), [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true)] [call](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/call) BIS_fnc_setDate; *// Skip 4 hours. Same as image in description*
```

```sqf
[30 / 60, [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true), [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true)] [call](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/call) BIS_fnc_setDate; *// Skip 30 minutes and show **30 minutes later** message*
```

bis_fnc_unitheadgear.name: BIS_fnc_unitHeadgear
bis_fnc_unitheadgear.description:
Randomise headgear and facewear of a character.
> ⚠If the randomization is disabled, only strings parameters will be processed, array will be ignored and considered as false.

syntaxArray.Params:
unit: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object)
headgear: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean), [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) or [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - (Optional, default [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false)) can be one of:

* [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - if [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false), change nothing to the headgear

* [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - valid Headgear class or a valid class from [Description.ext CfgUnitTemplates](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Description.ext#CfgUnitTemplates)

* [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - headgear list with individual probability
facewear: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean), [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) or [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - (Optional, default [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false)) can be one of:

* [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - if [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false), change nothing to the facewear

* [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - valid facewear class or a valid class from [Description.ext CfgUnitTemplates](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Description.ext#CfgUnitTemplates)

* [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - facewear list with individual probability

examples:
```sqf
[[this](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Magic_Variables#this_2)] [call](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/call) BIS_fnc_unitHeadgear;					 // headgear and face wear, same as [this, [], []]
```

```sqf
[[this](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Magic_Variables#this_2), [], []] [call](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/call) BIS_fnc_unitHeadgear;			*// headgear only*
```

```sqf
[[this](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Magic_Variables#this_2), [nil](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/nil), []]  [call](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/call) BIS_fnc_unitHeadgear;			*// facewear only*
```

```sqf
[[this](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Magic_Variables#this_2), "myTemplate"]  [call](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/call) BIS_fnc_unitHeadgear;	 // class defined in [Description.ext CfgUnitTemplates](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Description.ext#CfgUnitTemplates)
```

bis_fnc_bitflagsflip.name: BIS_fnc_bitflagsFlip
bis_fnc_bitflagsflip.description:
Flips one or more flags (set gets unset and vice versa) in the given flagset, represented with decimal or hexadecimal number
(Hexadecimal number representation is simply auto-converted into decimal by the engine)
To check which flags are present in given flagset use [BIS_fnc_bitflagsToArray](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/BIS_fnc_bitflagsToArray)
**Limitations**:
Due to various limitations of the Real Virtuality engine this function is 
intended to work with unsigned 24 bit integers only. This means that the 
supported range is 2^0...2^24 (1...16777216)

syntaxArray.Params:
flagset: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - flagset
flag: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - one or more flags to flip
syntaxArray.Return: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number)  - new flagset with given flag or flags flipped

examples:
```sqf
[1 + 16, 8] [call](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/call) BIS_fnc_bitflagsFlip; // 25 (which is 1 + 8 + 16)
[25, 8] [call](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/call) BIS_fnc_bitflagsFlip; // 17 (which is 1 + 16)
[2 + 4 + 8, 2 + 8] [call](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/call) BIS_fnc_bitflagsFlip; // 4
[4, 2 + 8] [call](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/call) BIS_fnc_bitflagsFlip; // 14 (which is 2 + 4 + 8)
```

bis_fnc_ambientplanes.name: BIS_fnc_ambientPlanes

bis_fnc_sceneintruderdetector.description:
Checks if there are intruders during scene. All intruders during scene will be disabled if they

```sqf

```

0: Number - Size A
1: Number - Size B

bis_fnc_addrespawninventory.name: BIS_fnc_addRespawnInventory
bis_fnc_addrespawninventory.description:
Add a respawn inventory for [respawn menu](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3_Respawn#MenuInventory).
Available loadouts are defined in [CfgRespawnInventory](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Description.ext#CfgRespawnInventory).

syntaxArray.Params:
target: Receiver of the respawn loadout

* [Namespace](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Namespace) - use [missionNamespace](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/missionNamespace) to add the loadout to everyone

* [Side](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Side)

* [Group](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Group)

* [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object)
inventoryParams: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) or [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String)

* [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - [CfgRespawnInventory](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Description.ext#CfgRespawnInventory) class

* [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - format [class, number, limit]

* class: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - [CfgRespawnInventory](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Description.ext#CfgRespawnInventory) class

* number: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Number of players who can use this inventory (-1 = no limit, default)

* limit: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Limit for role assigned to given loadout (-1 = no limit, default)

* Only role or only loadout can be limited at one moment, if there is limit for both, then only role uses limit.

* If the limit definition for role is called multiple times with different numbers, then the highest number is used.

bis_fnc_addweapon.name: BIS_fnc_addWeapon
bis_fnc_addweapon.description:
Adds a weapon to the specified unit, with magazine classnames taken from the weapon's config (in [CfgWeapons](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Weapons)).
This function does not remove magazines nor weapons prior to adding the new weapon, so that still has to be done manually.

syntaxArray.Params:
unit: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - Unit to add weapon to.
weaponClassName: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Weapon Classname (found in [CfgWeapons](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Weapons)).
quantity: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Amount of magazines.
type: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) or [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - (Optional, default 0)

* [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Index of magazine name that should be used - found in 
```sqf
magazines = {}
```
 array.

* [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Magazine name to be used.

examples:
Add 6 dual-purpose magazines and the underwater gun to the player:

```sqf
newGun = [[player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player), "arifle_SDAR_F", 6] [call](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/call) BIS_fnc_addWeapon;
```
Adds 2 × 30 Rnd Stanag Tracer (Red) magazines to bluforUnit, with an Mk20_F:

```sqf
newGun = [bluforUnit, "arifle_Mk20_F", 2, 1] [call](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/call) BIS_fnc_addWeapon;
```
Alternative syntax of second example, with magazine name written out:

```sqf
newGun = [bluforUnit, "arifle_Mk20_F", 2, "30Rnd_556x45_Stanag_Tracer_red"] [call](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/call) BIS_fnc_addWeapon;
```

size: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - (Optional, default 10) object size in metres
zCoeff: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - (Optional, default 2) vertical coefficient. All Z coordinates will be multiplied by this number to highlight hills and mountains

bis_fnc_eventtimeline.name: BIS_fnc_eventTimeline
bis_fnc_eventtimeline.description: Universal system for playing sequential events defined by time. > ⓘ*codeInterrupt* and *codeEnd* are [called](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/call) while the code in the timeline is [spawned](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/spawn).

syntaxArray.Params:
timeline: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - Timeline in format [ [1.0, {code} ], [2.0, {code} ], [2.3, {code} ], [4.7, {code} ] ]
index: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - (Optional, default 0) Index of the event to play
music: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - (Optional, default "") Music to be played which will provide the sync time for the timeline
codeInterrupt: [Code](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Code) - (Optional, default

```sqf
[params](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/params) ["_pointer", "_baseTime", "_evenTime"];
```


```sqf
["Timeline interrupted while playing event nr.: %1 (%2)", _pointer, _baseTime + _eventTime] [call](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/call) [BIS_fnc_logFormat](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/BIS_fnc_logFormat);
```
)Code to be executed if the timeline is interrupted with 

```sqf
[missionNamespace](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/missionNamespace) [setVariable](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/setVariable) ["BIS_fnc_eventTimeline_playing", [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false)]
```

codeEnd: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) or [Code](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Code) - (Optional, default [nil](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/nil)) [Code](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Code) or [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) of codes to be executed once the timeline is finished. The codes are [called](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/call) one after the other.

bis_fnc_ambientanim.name: BIS_fnc_ambientAnim
bis_fnc_ambientanim.description:
Play set of ambient animations on given unit. If the unit should react to combat, use [BIS_fnc_ambientAnimCombat](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/BIS_fnc_ambientAnimCombat) instead.
> ⓘAnimations can be cancelled using 
> ```sqf
> _unit [call](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/call) **BIS_fnc_ambientAnim__terminate**
> ```
> .

syntaxArray.Syntax: [unit, animationSet, equipmentLevel, snapTo, interpolate, attachToLogic] call BIS_fnc_ambientAnim
syntaxArray.Params:
unit: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - unit that will play the animations
animationSet: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - the animation set to play. Possible values:

*some values are missing due to duplicate results, e.g "STAND" does the same as "STAND1"*




* STAND1

* STAND2

* STAND_U1

* STAND_U2

* STAND_U3

* WATCH

* WATCH2

* GUARD

* LISTEN_BRIEFING

* LEAN_ON_TABLE

* LEAN



* SIT_AT_TABLE

* SIT1

* SIT

* SIT3

* SIT_U1

* SIT_U2

* SIT_U3

* SIT_HIGH1

* SIT_HIGH

* SIT_LOW

* SIT_LOW_U

* SIT_SAD1

* SIT_SAD2



* KNEEL

* REPAIR_VEH_PRONE

* REPAIR_VEH_KNEEL

* REPAIR_VEH_STAND

* PRONE_INJURED_U1

* PRONE_INJURED_U2

* PRONE_INJURED

* KNEEL_TREAT

* KNEEL_TREAT2

* BRIEFING

* BRIEFING_POINT_LEFT

* BRIEFING_POINT_RIGHT

* BRIEFING_POINT_TABLE

equipmentLevel: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - the equipment level of the unit. Possible values:

* NONE

* LIGHT

* MEDIUM

* FULL

* ASIS

* RANDOM
snapTo: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - (Optional, default [objNull](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/objNull)) the object where the unit will be snapped to
interpolate: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - (Optional, default [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false)) should try to interpolate into the ambient animation. Works only for some default stances
attachToLogic: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - (Optional, default [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true)) [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) to [attach](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/attachTo) the unit to the created logic object, forcing it in one position

examples:
```sqf
[[player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player), "STAND1", "ASIS"] [call](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/call) BIS_fnc_ambientAnim;
```

```sqf
*// will search for a chair within 2 meters around the unit and will place the unit on it*
[_unit, "SIT", "NONE"] [call](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/call) BIS_fnc_ambientAnim;
```

bis_fnc_arrayunshift.name: BIS_fnc_arrayUnShift
bis_fnc_arrayunshift.description:
This function adds an element to the beginning of an array and returns the array.
The array is passed by reference so changes inside the function will be reflected outside of it.

syntaxArray.Params:
array: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
value: [Anything](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Anything)

examples:
```sqf
_array = [2,3,4];
[_array, 1] [call](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/call) BIS_fnc_arrayUnShift;				// _array is now [1,2,3,4]
```

```sqf
_array = [[2,3,4], 1] [call](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/call) BIS_fnc_arrayUnShift;	// _array is now [1,2,3,4]
```

bis_fnc_createsimpleobject.name: BIS_fnc_createSimpleObject
bis_fnc_createsimpleobject.description:
Creates non-simulated framerate and network performance friendly object - a simple object - and applies different adjustments to fake non-existing physX and engine interactions. The adjustments need either to be stored in the object config or provided as the function input, otherwise they need to be done manually.

Simple objects cannot be destroyed and do not interact with the environment. They are useful for creating low performance-demanding static compositions (walls, rocks, wrecks, …) and/or environments where shooting and collisions are not expected.

syntaxArray.Params:
input: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) or [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array):

* [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String): classname of the object to be created. This is the preferred way if the asset config definition contains the adjustment data or the data are not needed (most objects do not need adjustments).

* [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array): adjustment data in format [class, model, reversed, verticalOffset, animationAdjustments, selectionsToHide]:

* class: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - (Optional, default "") asset CfgVehicles config class (**at least either *model* or *class* must be provided, ideally both**)

* model: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - (Optional, default "") Path to the vehicle p3d model; needs to start without backslash and must end with the proper file extension ".p3d"

* reversed: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - (Optional, default 0) some objects, usually vehicles, are reveresed in p3d; valid values are:

*  0: no change

*  1: reverse

* -1: unknown (behaves as 0)

* verticalOffset: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - (Optional, default 0) fix for non-existant physX; usually needed only for vehicles

* animationAdjustments: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - (Optional, default []) Animation that need to be animated to given state, in format [animationName, animationState]:

* animationName: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - animation name

* animationState: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - animation state

* selectionsToHide: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - (Optional, default []) all listed selections will be hidden
 
position: [PositionWorld](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Position#PositionWorld)
direction: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - (Optional, default 0)
followTerrain: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - (Optional, default true) [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) to follow terrain inclination, [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false) to be horizontally aligned
forceSuperSimpleObject: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - (Optional, default false) [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) to create a **Super Simple Object** from p3d path (that ***must*** be provided)
syntaxArray.Return: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - the created Simple Object, [objNull](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/objNull) if creation failed

bis_fnc_exportcfggroups.name: BIS_fnc_exportCfgGroups
bis_fnc_exportcfggroups.description:
/*

	Description:
	Export group or object composition for use in CfgGroups. The result will be copied to clipboard.

	Parameter(s):
		0: position (for supported types see BIS_fnc_position). Screen center is used by default
		1: objects to be saved. Currently selected objects in curator are used by default
			ARRAY of OBJECTs - specific objects to be saved
			array in format used by nearEntities, which automatically get nearby objects
				0: STRING or ARRAY of STRINGS - object types
				1: NUMBER - radius in metres

	Returns:
	STRING
*/


> 🏗Placeholder description extracted from the function header by [BIS_fnc_exportFunctionsToWiki](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/BIS_fnc_exportFunctionsToWiki).

bis_fnc_objectsmapper.name: BIS_fnc_objectsMapper
bis_fnc_objectsmapper.description:
Takes an array of data about a dynamic object template and creates the objects.

	Parameter(s):
	_this select 0: position of the template - Array [X, Y, Z]
	_this select 1: azimuth of the template in degrees - Number 
	_this select 2: objects for the template - Array / composition class - String / tag list - Array
	_this select 3: (optional) randomizer value (how much chance each object has of being created. 0.0 is 100% chance) - Number

	Returns:
	Created objects (Array)

syntaxArray.Params:
position: [Position](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Position) - (Optional, default [0,0])
azimuth: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - (Optional, default 0) the template orientation
objectsArray: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - created with [BIS_fnc_objectsGrabber](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/BIS_fnc_objectsGrabber)
badChance: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - (Optional, default 0) must be in range 0..1. Chances of object non-creation for each object

mode: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Can be:


* "init"

* "VerticalToggle"

* "SurfaceSnapToggle"

* "MoveGridToggle"

* "RotateGridToggle"

* "ScaleGridToggle"

* "WidgetToggle"

* "ToggleMap"

* "ToggleVision"

* "ToggleFlashlight"

* "MissionSection"
syntaxArray.Return: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - Returns [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) if it was added successfully

bis_fnc_target.name: BIS_fnc_target
bis_fnc_target.description:
[](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/File:A3_BIS_fnc_target.jpg)  [](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/File:A3_BIS_fnc_target.jpg)Target Board display
Handles the shooting targets in the Bootcamp DLC, statistics, animation, etc. (targets such as TargetBootcampHuman_f)

syntaxArray.Params:
action: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String)
parameters: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)



Action [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String)
Parameters ([Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)) arguments


**initialize**Initializes the target and sets it to the "up" position



* target: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - Target object of type "TargetBootcamp_base_F"


**terminate**Doesn't do anything
N/A


**animate**Animate the object to the given position ("up" or "down")



* target: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - Target object of type "TargetBootcamp_base_F"

* position: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - "up" or "down" (default)


**getAnimationPhase****Return Value:** [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - 0 (up) or 1 (down) depending on current state



* target: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - Target object of type "TargetBootcamp_base_F"


**getAnimationPhaseString****Return Value:** [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - "up" or "down" depending on current state



* target: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - Target object of type "TargetBootcamp_base_F"


**getAnimatedSelection****Return Value:** [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - the name of the "animatedSelection" from object config



* target: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - Target object of type "TargetBootcamp_base_F"


**hit**Handles the hit event to animate the target down and up again



* target: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - Target object of type "TargetBootcamp_base_F"

* unit: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - Unit which shot the target

* damage: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Amount of damage done to the target


**hitPart**Handles the hit event and stores the data



* partsList: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - Contains list of all parts which got hit (see [HitPart EH](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3:_Event_Handlers#HitPart) format) to format [target, shooter]:

* target: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - Target object of type 'TargetBootcamp_base_F'

* shooter: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - Unit which shot the target


**getShooterDataIndex****Return Value:** [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - index from Shooter Data for specific unit



* target: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - Target object of type "TargetBootcamp_base_F"

* uid: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Player UID of unit who shot the target


**getShooterData****Return Value:** [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - all data from Shooter Data for specific unit
Format: [["uid", ""], ["name", ""], ["shots", [[["time", 0], ["distance", 0], ["weapon", ""], ["direct", 0]]]]]




* target: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - Target object of type "TargetBootcamp_base_F"

* uid: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Player UID of unit who shot the target


**setShooterData**Set Shooter Data for specific unit



* target: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - Target object of type "TargetBootcamp_base_F"

* uid: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Player UID of unit who shot the target

* data: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - Shooter Data


**getShotsData****Return Value:** [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - Shots Data for specific unit



* target: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - Target object of type "TargetBootcamp_base_F"

* uid: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Player UID of unit who shot the target


**getShotsDataFromTargets****Return Value:** [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - total amount of shots hit



* targets: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) of [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - List of target objects of type "TargetBootcamp_base_F"

* uid: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Player UID of unit who shot the target


**getShotsDataWithFilter****Return Value:** [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - Shot Data after custom filter



* target: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - Target object of type "TargetBootcamp_base_F"

* uid: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Player UID of unit who shot the target

* filter: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - One of "time", "distance", "weapon" or "direct"

* code: [Code](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Code) - Custom code to validate the shot. _this is the value of filtered data


**setShotsData**Set Shots Data for specific unit



* target: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - Target object of type "TargetBootcamp_base_F"

* uid: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Player UID of unit who shot the target

* data: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - Shots Data


**getShootersData****Return Value:** [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - full Shooters Data



* target: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - Target object of type "TargetBootcamp_base_F"


**setShootersData**Set full Shooters Data



* target: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - Target object of type "TargetBootcamp_base_F"

* data: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - Shooter Data


**resetShootersData**Remove all data from Shooters Data array



* target: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - Target object of type "TargetBootcamp_base_F"


**getShooterTemplate****Return Value:** [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - template for Shooter Data



* target: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - Target object of type "TargetBootcamp_base_F"

* uid: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Player UID of unit who shot the target


**getShotTemplate****Return Value:** [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - template for Shot Data (see [HitPart EH](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3:_Event_Handlers#HitPart) format)



* target: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - Target object of type "TargetBootcamp_base_F"

* shooter: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - Unit who shot the target

* projectile: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - ("_bullet" not used)

* position: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) format [Position](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Position) - ("_position" not used)

* velocity: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - ("_velocity" not used)

* selection: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - ("_selection" not used)

* ammo: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - ("_ammo" not used)

* vector: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - ("_direction" not used)

* radius: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - ("_radius" not used)

* surfaceType: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - ("_surface" not used)

* isDirect: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) if object was directly hit, [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false) if it was hit by indirect/splash damage.


**getShooterByUid****Return Value:** [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - corresponding shooter unit



* uid: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Player UID of unit who shot the target


**uiOpen**Opens the Target Board display



* target: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - Target object of type "TargetBootcamp_base_F"


**uiOpenToAll**Opens the Target Board display for all connected players



* target: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - Target object of type "TargetBootcamp_base_F"


**uiOnLoad**Triggered when display is opened (internal)



* display: [Display](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Display)


**uiFillTable**Triggered when display is opened, fills UI with Shooters Data (internal)



* target: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - Target object of type "TargetBootcamp_base_F"

* control: [Control](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Control) - "_listBox"


**uiFillTableRow**Triggered when display is opened, fills UI with Shooter Data (internal)



* target: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - Target object of type "TargetBootcamp_base_F"

* control: [Control](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Control) - "_listBox"

* data: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - Shooter Data

examples:
```sqf
*// open the Score Board*
["uiOpen", [myTarget]] [call](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/call) BIS_fnc_target;
```

```sqf
*// open the Score Board for all players in MP*
["uiOpenToAll", [myTarget]] [call](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/call) BIS_fnc_target;
```

```sqf
*// clear all data from Score Board*
["resetShootersData", [myTarget]] [call](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/call) BIS_fnc_target;
```

bis_fnc_packstaticweapon.name: BIS_fnc_packStaticWeapon
bis_fnc_packstaticweapon.description:
This function will make weapon team pack a static weapon. The weapon crew will pack carried weapon (or given weapon if different) and follow leader. Requires three personnel in the team: Team Leader, Gunner and Asst. Gunner. This function is MP compatible

When weapon is packed, scripted EH "StaticWeaponPacked" is called with the following params: 

* [group, leader, gunner, assistant, weaponBag, tripodBag]

> ⓘIf a unit flees, all bets are off and the function will exit leaving units on their own. To guarantee weapon disassembly, make sure the group has maximum courage 
> ```sqf
> _group [allowFleeing](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/allowFleeing) 0;
> ```
>

syntaxArray.Params:
group: [Group](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Group) or [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - the support team group or a unit from this group
weapon (Optional): [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - weapon to pack. If [nil](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/nil), current group weapon is packed
leaderPos (Optional):  [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array), [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) or [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - position, object or marker the group leader should move to after weapon is packed. By default the group will resume on to the next assigned waypoint. If this param is provided, group will not go to the next waypoint and will move to given position instead
functionName: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - function name (if not defined, name of parent function is used)

bis_fnc_carrier01edendelete.name: BIS_fnc_carrier01EdenDelete
bis_fnc_carrier01edendelete.description:
/*
	Author: Bravo Zero One development
	- John_Spartan

	Description:
	- This is a sub function designed to delete dynamic aircrfat carrier in EDEN editor. Carrier consists of multiple sub-objects that are linked together bnased on precise memory point positions in 3D space.
	Function will delete carrier parts in EDEN editor after main object is deleted.

	Exucution:
	- Call from EH on the main carrier base model (blank model with momory points and reference config).

		Example:
		class Eventhandlers
		{
			init = "_this call BIS_fnc_Carrier01Init";								//main init fnc, will assemble carrier in game
			AttributesChanged3DEN = "_this call BIS_fnc_Carrier01EdenInit";			//function to update objects position in EDEN editor if attributes changed by player
			Dragged3DEN = "_this call BIS_fnc_Carrier01PosUpdate";					//function to update objects position in EDEN editor if attributes changed by player
			RegisteredToWorld3DEN = "_this call BIS_fnc_Carrier01EdenInit";			//initial EDEN init fnc (main init is still called)
			UnregisteredFromWorld3DEN = "_this call BIS_fnc_Carrier01EdenDelete";	//function  to delete all carrier objects in EDEN editor
		};

	Requirments:
	- An array of carrier parts/objects as a variable attached to main carrier base. This array is created by main BIS_fnc_Carrier01Init.

	Parameter(s):
		_this select 0: mode (Scalar)
		0: carrier Base/object
		and
		1: array of objects in variable in base objects namespace ["bis_carrierParts", []];


	Returns: nothing
	Result: Aircraft Carrier's parts are deleted in EDEN editor.

*/
> 🏗Placeholder description extracted from the function header by [BIS_fnc_exportFunctionsToWiki](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/BIS_fnc_exportFunctionsToWiki).

bis_fnc_getfactions.name: BIS_fnc_getFactions
bis_fnc_getfactions.description: Gets list and sides of current factions.

syntaxArray.Params:
parameter:

* [Nothing](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Nothing) or empty [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - returns all factions

* [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - returns index of the object side

* [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - [side](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/side) of the first element is returned, others are ignored

examples:
```sqf
[call](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/call) BIS_fnc_getFactions; *// returns all factions*
```

```sqf
[] [call](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/call) BIS_fnc_getFactions; // same as *Example 1*
```

```sqf
[[player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player)] [call](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/call) BIS_fnc_getFactions; // returns index of player's faction
```

```sqf
["BLU_F"] [call](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/call) BIS_fnc_getFactions; *// returns index of given faction*
```

```sqf
[[]] [call](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/call) BIS_fnc_getFactions; *// will return all faction sides*
```

```sqf
[[[player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player)]] [call](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/call) BIS_fnc_getFactions; // will return player's side
```

bis_fnc_shakemapeh.name: BIS_fnc_shakeMapEH
bis_fnc_shakemapeh.description:
/*
	Author: Riccardo Argiolas

	Description:
    	Event handler function for the shakeMap.sqf function

	Parameters:
	Select 0 - NUMBER: duration of shake effect.
	Select 1 - NUMBER: magnitude of the shaking force.
	Select 2 - ARRAY: position of the camera center around which the shake effect occurs.
	Select 3 - NUMBER: starting shake time (i.e. time elapsed since mission started till the start of the shake animation).

	Returns: None

	Examples:

		private _shakeEventCode = format ["[%1, %2, %3, %4] call BIS_fnc_drawMapShake", _shakeDuration, _shakeMagnitude, _shakeCenter, time];
		BIS_shakeEventHandler = _map ctrladdeventhandler ["draw",_shakeEventCode];

bis_fnc_ordinalnumber.name: BIS_fnc_ordinalNumber
bis_fnc_ordinalnumber.description: Return number as ordinal number (e.g. 1 become "1st")

syntaxArray.Params:
number: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number)
language: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - (Optional, current game [language](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/language))
isFeminine: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - (Optional, default [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false))

examples:
```sqf
_second = [42] [call](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/call) BIS_fnc_ordinalNumber; *// will return "42nd" for English-speaking players*
```

```sqf
_num1enm = [1, "English", [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false)] [call](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/call) BIS_fnc_ordinalNumber; *// returns "1st"*
_num1frm = [1, "French",  [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false)] [call](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/call) BIS_fnc_ordinalNumber; *// returns "1er"*
_num1frw = [1, "French",   [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true)] [call](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/call) BIS_fnc_ordinalNumber; *// returns "1re"*
_num1esm = [1, "Spanish", [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false)] [call](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/call) BIS_fnc_ordinalNumber; *// returns "1"*
_num1esw = [1, "Spanish",  [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true)] [call](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/call) BIS_fnc_ordinalNumber; *// returns "1*" for Portuguese, Italian and Spanish*
```

```sqf
_num1en = [1, "English"] [call](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/call) BIS_fnc_ordinalNumber; *// returns "1st"*
_num2en = [2, "English"] [call](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/call) BIS_fnc_ordinalNumber; *// returns "2nd"*
_num3en = [3, "English"] [call](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/call) BIS_fnc_ordinalNumber; *// returns "3rd"*
_num4en = [4, "English"] [call](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/call) BIS_fnc_ordinalNumber; *// returns "4th"*
_num9en = [9, "English"] [call](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/call) BIS_fnc_ordinalNumber; *// returns "9th"*
```

```sqf
_second = [1, "unknownLanguage"] [call](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/call) BIS_fnc_ordinalNumber; *// will return "1." if language is not recognised/supported*
```

bis_fnc_planeaieject.name: BIS_fnc_planeAiEject
bis_fnc_planeaieject.description:
/*
	Author: Bravo Zero One development
	- John_Spartan

	Description:
	- This function is designed as part of set of functions to implement semi-authenthic ejection system on fixed wing aircrfat that have such functionality enabled/configured.
	- AI behaviour handler.

	Exucution:
	- Call the function via attached EH to the aircrfat itself.

		Example:
		class Eventhandlers: Eventhandlers
		{
			Hit = "_this call BIS_fnc_planeAiEject";
		};

	Requirments:
	- Compatible aircrfat must have a config definition for all subsytems that will be invoked by ejection system (see BIS_fnc_PlaneEjection).

	Parameter(s):
		_this select 0: mode (Scalar)
		0: plane/object


	Returns: nothing
	Result: AI pilot will be forced to eject from aircrfat upon damage treshold reached. Semi-authenthic behaviour.

*/
> 🏗Placeholder description extracted from the function header by [BIS_fnc_exportFunctionsToWiki](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/BIS_fnc_exportFunctionsToWiki).

bis_fnc_simpleobjectdata.name: BIS_fnc_simpleObjectData
bis_fnc_simpleobjectdata.description: Get complete data needed for simple object creation.

syntaxArray.Params:
classname: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) or [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String):

* [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - Existing object or simple object that will be scanned; if it is a simple object '_reversed' attribute cannot be retrieved

* [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Can be either:

* Classname of the object; data are retrieved from the config definition.

* Path to the p3d; verifies and fixes model path format and returns it in an array (index 1).It has very limited functionality in this mode as no data can actually be retrieved from model path.
syntaxArray.Return:
[Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) in format [class, model, reversed, verticalOffset, animationAdjustments, selectionsToHide, verticalOffsetWorld, textures, randomizeAnims, randomizeTexs]:

* class: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - (Default "") class name from CfgVehicles

* model: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - (Default "") path to the vehicle p3d mode

* reversed: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - (Default 0) reverse value, to fix orientation. 0: no change, 1: reverse

* verticalOffset: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - (Default 0) vertical offset

* animationAdjustments: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - (Default []) animation to animate, every element has this format: [_animationName:string,_animationState:scalar]

* hiddenSelections: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - (Default []) all listed selection will be hidden

* verticalOffsetWorld: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - vertical offset in World coordinates; similar to [ASL](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki?title=ASL&action=edit&redlink=1) but refers to object at [0,0,0], not its land contacts

* textures: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - textures currently applied to the object

* randomizeAnims: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - (Default false) true if vehicle supports randomization through animations

* randomizeTexs: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - (Default false) true if vehicle supports randomization of textures

> ⓘReturn values can be used with [BIS_fnc_adjustSimpleObject](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/BIS_fnc_adjustSimpleObject).

examples:
```sqf

```

```sqf
_isLeapYear = 2036 [call](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/call) BIS_fnc_isLeapYear; *// 2036 is a leap year*
```

bis_fnc_fps.name: BIS_fnc_fps
bis_fnc_fps.description: Function to measure FPS. Spawns code running for given time and displays result on screen *via* [titleText](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/titleText), [globalChat](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/globalChat) **and** [diag_log](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/diag_log). Variable **BIS_fps_output** is filled with diag_log content too.

syntaxArray.Params:
duration: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - the FPS test duration
sceneId: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - (Optional, default "") scene ID, used in outputs. Fills global variable **currentScene**
startDelay: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - (Optional, default 0) delay before starting measurement

bis_fnc_destroyer01edeninit.name: BIS_fnc_destroyer01EdenInit
bis_fnc_destroyer01edeninit.description:
/*
	Author: Bravo Zero One development
	- John_Spartan

	Description:
	- This is a sub function designed to assemble dynamic ship (multi-part structure) in EDEN editor. Ship consists of multiple sub-objects that are linked together based on precise memory point positions in 3D space.
	Function will update initial init setup on EDEN editor invoked.

	Execution:
	- Call from EH on the main ship's base model (blank model with memory points and reference config).

		Example:
		class Eventhandlers
		{
			init = "_this call bis_fnc_Destroyer01Init";								//main init fnc, will assemble ship in game
			AttributesChanged3DEN = "_this call bis_fnc_Destroyer01EdenInit";			//function to update objects position in EDEN editor if attributes changed by player
			Dragged3DEN = "_this call bis_fnc_Destroyer01PosUpdate";					//function to update objects position in EDEN editor if attributes changed by player
			RegisteredToWorld3DEN = "_this call bis_fnc_Destroyer01EdenInit";			//initial EDEN init fnc (main init is still called)
			UnregisteredFromWorld3DEN = "_this call bis_fnc_Destroyer01EdenDelete";		//function  to delete all ship objects in EDEN editor
		};

	Requirements:
	- An array of ship parts/objects as a variable attached to main ship base. This array is created by main BIS_fnc_Destroyer01Init.

	Parameter(s):
		_this select 0: mode (Scalar)
		0: ship Base/object
		and
		1: array of objects in variable in base objects names-pace ["bis_carrierParts", []];


	Returns: nothing
	Result: Ship's position is updated in EDEN editor.

*/> 🏗Placeholder description extracted from the function header by [BIS_fnc_exportFunctionsToWiki](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/BIS_fnc_exportFunctionsToWiki).

bis_fnc_hextorgb.name: BIS_fnc_HEXtoRGB
bis_fnc_hextorgb.description: Convert hexcode color into RGBA array format.

syntaxArray.Params: hexString: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - string representing **4 octets** of HEX color
syntaxArray.Return: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) of [Numbers](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - array of **4** numbers in range 0..1

examples:
```sqf
["025D00FF"] [call](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/call) BIS_fnc_HEXtoRGB; // [1,0.843138,0,1]
```
Usually HEX code is represented as 3 octet without alpha, so you can add it yourself:
```sqf
[_hexString + "FF"] [call](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/call) BIS_fnc_HEXtoRGB; // Add 4th octet to get alpha
```

bin_fnc_setpointofinterest.name: BIN_fnc_setPointOfInterest
bin_fnc_setpointofinterest.description:
/*

	Description:
		Add point of interest shown in the map

	Parameter(s):
		0: STRING - unique ID of the point
		1:
			BOOL - true if the point is completed (shown faded in the map)
			NUMBER - status, can be:
				-1: dormant, will be activated when player gets close
				 0: shown, but not completed
				+1: completed
		2: ARRAY - position
		3: ARRAY - area in format [width,height,angle,isRectangle]
		4: STRING - type, can be "Unknown" or "Warning" (default: "Unknown")
		5: STRING - color, can be "Black", "Blue" or "Red" (default: "Black")

		or

		0: OBJECT - "Point of interest" module

	Returns:
		STRING - ID of the point

	Examples:

		//--- Activate existing module
		_myID = myModule call BIN_fnc_setPointOfInterest;

		//--- Mark POI as completed
		[_myID,true] call BIN_fnc_setPointOfInterest;

		//--- Set custom POI
		["myID",false,position myObject,[50,50,0,false],"Warning","Red"] call BIN_fnc_setPointOfInterest;

		//--- Set custom POI using default type and color
		["myID",false,position myObject,[50,50,0,false]] call BIN_fnc_setPointOfInterest;
*/


#define VAR			"bin_POIs"
#define TASK_PRIORITY		2
#define REVEAL_DISTANCE		100

#define POS_DEFAULT		[]
#define AREA_DEFAULT		[]
#define TYPE_DEFAULT		""
#define COLOR_DEFAULT		""
#define STATUS_DEFAULT		0

> 🏗Placeholder description extracted from the function header by [BIS_fnc_exportFunctionsToWiki](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/BIS_fnc_exportFunctionsToWiki).

conditionEnd: [Code](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Code) - (Optional, default {}) Condition to end fire support

bis_fnc_destroyer01posupdate.name: BIS_fnc_destroyer01PosUpdate
bis_fnc_destroyer01posupdate.description:
/*
	Author: Bravo Zero One development
	- John_Spartan

	Description:
	- This is a sub function designed to update dynamic ships (multi-part structure) position in EDEN editor. Ship consists of multiple sub-objects that are linked together based on precise memory point positions in 3D space.
	Function will update initial object positions when player drags the object in EDEN editor.

	Execution:
	- Call from EH on the main ship base model (blank model with memory points and reference config).

		Example:
		class Eventhandlers
		{
			init = "_this call BIS_fnc_Destroyer01Init";								//main init fnc, will assemble ship in game
			AttributesChanged3DEN = "_this call BIS_fnc_Destroyer01EdenInit";			//function to update objects position in EDEN editor if attributes changed by player
			Dragged3DEN = "_this call BIS_fnc_Destroyer01PosUpdate";					//function to update objects position in EDEN editor if attributes changed by player
			RegisteredToWorld3DEN = "_this call BIS_fnc_Destroyer01EdenInit";			//initial EDEN init fnc (main init is still called)
			UnregisteredFromWorld3DEN = "_this call BIS_fnc_Destroyer01EdenDelete";		//function  to delete all ship objects in EDEN editor
		};

	Requirements:
	- An array of ship parts/objects as a variable attached to main ship base. This array is created by main BIS_fnc_Destroyer01Init.

	Parameter(s):
		_this select 0: mode (Scalar)
		0: ship Base/object
		and
		1: array of objects in variable in base objects name-space ["bis_carrierParts", []];


	Returns: nothing
	Result: Ship's position is updated in EDEN editor.

*/> 🏗Placeholder description extracted from the function header by [BIS_fnc_exportFunctionsToWiki](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/BIS_fnc_exportFunctionsToWiki).

bis_fnc_exp_camp_iff.name: BIS_fnc_EXP_camp_IFF
bis_fnc_exp_camp_iff.description:
Simple handling of the Support Team's scripted IFF. 

Notes:

* To always show the icon and name of a unit, use: 	
```sqf
<unit> setVariable ["BIS_iconAlways", true];
```


* Otherwise, icons can be hidden with:     
```sqf
<unit> setVariable ["BIS_iconShow", false];
```


* And names can be hidden with:      
```sqf
<unit> setVariable ["BIS_iconName", false];
```

bis_fnc_areequal.name: BIS_fnc_areEqual
bis_fnc_areequal.description:
This function returns true if all of the passed data elements are of the same type and value. One or more elements can be passed.

> [](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Arma_3)In Arma 3, see [isEqualTo](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/isEqualTo).
**NOTES:**


* This function is an improvement over the == operator, because it can handle any data type in any combination.

* For arrays, it returns true if both arrays hold the same elements in the same order.

* If both values are undefined / nil / null, then this function will return true.

* **WARNING:** EXTREMELY large strings (> 4k) or compiled code (from a file, for example) might not be properly compared if they are only different near the end of the file.

syntaxArray.Params: anythings: [Anything](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Anything) - any type of value: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array), [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean), [Code](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Code), [Control](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Control), [Config](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Config), [Group](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Group), [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number), [Script](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Script), [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object), [Display](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Display), [Side](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Side), [Text](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Text)

examples:
```sqf
[0, "0"]		[call](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/call) BIS_fnc_areEqual; *// false*
[0, 1 + 1 - 2]	[call](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/call) BIS_fnc_areEqual; *// true*
[[str](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/str) 50, "50"]	[call](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/call) BIS_fnc_areEqual; *// true*
```

syntaxArray.Params:
mode: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - "init" for scripted initialization, other modes are used when leaflets are fired as a weapon
parameters: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) to format:

* [leaflet, texture, text]

* leaflet: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - the leaflet object itself

* texture: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - texture path

* text: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - localized text, shown when previewing the leaflet in full screen

* [leaflet, cfgLeafletsClass]

* leaflet: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - the leaflet object itself

* cfgLeafletsClass: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - class name as string

**owner**: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - object to which the item belongs to
**itemID**: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - item ID returned by [BIS_fnc_addCommMenuItem](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/BIS_fnc_addCommMenuItem) command
syntaxArray.Return: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - true when the item was removed

bis_fnc_movein.name: BIS_fnc_moveIn
bis_fnc_movein.description: Moves a unit into vehicle. Compatible with [assignedVehicleRole](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/assignedVehicleRole) output.

syntaxArray.Params:
vehicle: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object)
unit: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - the unit to move into *vehicle*
role: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - wanted seat, in format [*"role"*] or [*"role"*, turretPath]. Can be one of:

* "driver"

* "gunner"

* "commander"

* "cargo"

* "turret"

* "": will load *unit* in the first available seat (using [moveInAny](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/moveInAny))

examples:
```sqf
[myCar, [player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player), "cargo"] [call]] BIS_fnc_moveIn;
```

```sqf
[myTank, [player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player), ["turret", [0]]] [call]] BIS_fnc_moveIn;
```

```sqf
[myTank, [player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player), ["turret", -1]] [call]] BIS_fnc_moveIn; // will [moveInDriver](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/moveInDriver) the player
```

bis_fnc_tasksetdestination.name: BIS_fnc_taskSetDestination
bis_fnc_tasksetdestination.description: Set a task's destination. > ⓘSee [Arma 3: Task Framework](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3:_Task_Framework) for more information.

syntaxArray.Params:
taskName: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String)
destination: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object), [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array), [Position](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Position) or [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) -  Task destination

* [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object): Task will be displayed on the object if player knows about it, otherwise it will be on estimated position or even hidden

* [ [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object), [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) ]: Task will be on exact object position, even if player doesn't know about the object

* [Position](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Position): Task will be on given positon

* [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String): Marker name. Task will be at markers current position (Won't update if marker was moved)

bis_fnc_sortby.name: BIS_fnc_sortBy
bis_fnc_sortby.description: Sorts an array according to given algorithm. See [sort](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/sort) for simple sorts.

syntaxArray.Syntax: [array, parameters, algorithm, direction, filter] call BIS_fnc_sortBy
syntaxArray.Params:
array: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - any unsorted array. Can contain any types
parameters: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)

* used in the eval algorithm

* input params are referenced in the sorting algorithm by _input0..9

* a maximum of 10 input params is supported (0-9)
algorithm: [Code](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Code) - (Optional, default { [_x](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Magic_Variables#x) })

* needs to return [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String), [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) or [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - see [sort](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/sort)

* [_x](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Magic_Variables#x) refers to array item
direction: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - (Optional, default "ASCEND") case-insensitive

* "ASCEND" for ascending sorting

* "DESCEND" (or anything else) for descending sorting
filter: [Code](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Code) - (Optional, default { [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) }) code that needs to evaluate true for the array item to be sorted, otherwise item is removed

examples:
```sqf
*// sort numbers from lowest to highest*
_sortedNumbers = [[1,-80,0,480,15,-40], [], {_x}, "ASCEND"] [call](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/call) BIS_fnc_sortBy;
```

```sqf
*// sort helicopters by distance from player*
_closestHelicopters = [[_heli1,_heli2,_heli3], [], { [player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player) [distance](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/distance) _x }, "ASCEND"] [call](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/call) BIS_fnc_sortBy;
```

```sqf
*// sort enemy by distance from friendly unit (referenced by local variable), the furthest first*
_furtherstEnemy = [[_enemy1,_enemy2,_enemy3], [_friendly], { _input0 [distance](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/distance) _x }, "DESCEND", { [canMove](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/canMove) _x }] [call](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/call) BIS_fnc_sortBy;
```

bis_fnc_markwaypoints.name: BIS_fnc_markWaypoints
bis_fnc_markwaypoints.description:
/*

	Description:
	Creates a marker on each uncompleted waypoint and marks it checked after completing that WP.
	Note: "On Activation" WP code is used for handling the markers; if this code is overwritten during the course, it can break this functionality

	Parameter(s):
	_this select 0: OBJECT - unit who will have its waypoints marked
	_this select 1 (Optional, use "" for default): STRING - text of hint shown after completing a waypoint, %1 is used for WP number (default "")
	_this select 2 (Optional, use [] for default): ARRAY of STRINGS - marker text format for [uncompleted, completed] waypoints, %1 is used for WP number (default ["%1", "%1"])
	_this select 3 (Optional, use [] for default): ARRAY of STRINGS - marker icon for [uncompleted, completed] waypoints (default ["mil_circle", "mil_circle"])
	_this select 4 (Optional, use [] for default): ARRAY of STRINGS - marker color for [uncompleted, completed] waypoints (default ["ColorRed", "ColorGreen"])
	_this select 5 (Optional, use [] for default): ARRAY of NUMBERS - marker size for [uncompleted, completed] waypoints (default [0.75, 0.75])

	Returns:
	NOTHING
*/
> 🏗Placeholder description extracted from the function header by [BIS_fnc_exportFunctionsToWiki](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/BIS_fnc_exportFunctionsToWiki).

bis_fnc_removeindex.name: BIS_fnc_removeIndex
bis_fnc_removeindex.description:
Takes an array, and returns a new array with the specified index(es)
removed.

This takes the array passed in the first parameter, and returns
an array that has the index number in the second parameter removed.

If a third parameter is passed, then a range of indexes will be removed.

Alternatively, you can pass an array of indexes to remove in the
second parameter.
> [](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Arma_3)Use [deleteAt](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/deleteAt) or [deleteRange](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/deleteRange) instead

syntaxArray.Params:
array: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
startIndex: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Start index to be removed, if parameter 3 isn't provided, only this index is removed
endIndex: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - (Optional, default [Nothing](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Nothing)) -  End index, if provided the indexs from startIndex to endIndex will be removed

array: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array)
indexes: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) of [numbers](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Indexes to be removed

bis_fnc_boatrack01initadjustzoffsets.name: BIS_fnc_boatRack01InitAdjustZOffsets
bis_fnc_boatrack01initadjustzoffsets.description:
/*
	Author: Bravo Zero One development
	- John_Spartan

	Description:
	- This is sub function for 'boat recovery' functionality.

	Execution:
	- Call from Init EH script that is added to object (boat rack).

	Example:
		[_boatRack] spawn bis_fnc_boatRack01InitAdjustZOffsets;

	Required:
		Object (boat rack) must have vehicle in vehicle behavior configured (https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3_Vehicle_in_Vehicle_Transport).
		Object (boat rack) must have triggers set up with continuous actions.
		Object (boat rack) must have set of Z offset's predefined in cfgVehicles for know/supported boat types.

		Parameters used from cfgVehicles configuration:
		cargoBayAnimationSelection 		= "CargoBay_Move_Z";
		supportedVehicleOffsetsZ[]		= {{"C_Boat_Civil_01_F",0.55}};

	Parameter(s):
		_this select 0: mode (Scalar)
		0: boat rack object
		and
		other parameters from boat rack's cfgVehicles configuration.

	Returns: nothing
	Result: On mission startup adjusts the hight (Z offset) of boat rack suspension to prevent different boats clipping with visual mesh.

*/> 🏗Placeholder description extracted from the function header by [BIS_fnc_exportFunctionsToWiki](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/BIS_fnc_exportFunctionsToWiki).

bis_fnc_showcuratorfeedbackmessage.name: BIS_fnc_showCuratorFeedbackMessage
bis_fnc_showcuratorfeedbackmessage.description:
Show feedback message when illegal operation is attempted in curator interface.
**Interface**

* **000**: Cannot exit Zeus interface

* **003**: Cannot move camera outside the camera area

**Placing**

* **101**: Placing objects is not available

* **102**: Insufficient resources

* **103**: Selected position is not in an editing area

**Placing waypoints**

* **201**: Placing waypoints is not available

* **206**: No objects, groups or waypoints selected

**Editing**

* **301**: Editing entities is not available

* **303**: Selected position is not inside editing area

* **304**: One of the selected entities is not in an editing area

* **307**: Players cannot be edited

* **308**: The vehicle is full

**Deleting**

* **401**: Deleting entities is not available

* **404**: One of the selected objects is not in an editing area

* **405**: One of selected vehicles has non-editable crew in it

* **407**: Players cannot be deleted

** Destroying**

* **501**: Destroying entities is not available

* **504**: One of the selected objects is not in an editing area

* **505**: One of the selected vehicles has non-editable crew in it

* **506**: No objects selected

* **507**: Players cannot be destroyed

**Syncing**

* **609**: At least one AI unit has to be present in synchronization

* **610**: Cannot change player side (typo: *"changle"*)

syntaxArray.Params:
curator: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - *not used*
messageInfo: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) or [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - error ID, or text message to be displayed

bis_fnc_kmlimport.name: BIS_fnc_KMLimport
bis_fnc_kmlimport.description:
Read positions from a [KML file](https://community.bistudio.comhttps://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Keyhole_Markup_Language).
> ⓘRecommended to execute in loading screen.

syntaxArray.Params:
filePath: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - (Optional, default 
```sqf
"hsim\Doc_H\GoogleEarth\Missions\" + [missionName](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/missionName) + ".kml"
```
) KML file path
> [](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Arma_3)Default value only works in Take On Helicopters. Do not rely on it in Arma 3
syntaxArray.Return:
[Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) of [Arrays](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) in format [type, positionXYZ, folder, name, description]

* type: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - 0 for a point, 1 for a line, 2 for a polygon

* positionXYZ: [Position](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Position) - format [PositionAGL](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/PositionAGL)

* folder: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - path to the value, "" if in the .kml root

* name: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - location's name

* description: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - location's description

bis_fnc_trimstring.name: BIS_fnc_trimString
bis_fnc_trimstring.description: Get a substring out of the string.

syntaxArray.Params:
someText: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - source string
beginning: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) (Optional, default 0) - start index; indexing starts at 0
length: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) (Optional, default end of string) - end index. A negative number means X chars *from the string end*

examples:
```sqf
["dreaded_is_the_man", 0, 6] [call](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/call) BIS_fnc_trimString; *// will return "dreaded"*
```

```sqf
["dreaded_is_the_man", 15] [call](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/call) BIS_fnc_trimString; *// will return "man"*
```

```sqf
["dreaded_is_the_man"] [call](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/call) BIS_fnc_trimString; *// will return "dreaded_is_the_man"*
```

bis_fnc_randomposintersection.name: BIS_fnc_randomPosIntersection
bis_fnc_randomposintersection.description: Returns random 2D position inside the intersection of two circles. [-1,-1] is returned if the circles do not intersect.

syntaxArray.Params:
firstCircle: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object), [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) or [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - First circle. Can be a trigger, a marker or an array in form 

* 0: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - circleCenter

* 0: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Coordinate X

* 1: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Coordinate Y

* 1: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - radius
secondCircle: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object), [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) or [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - Second circle. Same as above.
positioning1: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - (Optional, default -1) If a value between 0 and 1 is passed (0 and 1 included), then a gaussian distribution is used. This will influence the random position along the axis which connects the two circles' centers. A lower value means the position will be close to the first circle
positioning2: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - (Optional, default -1) If a value between 0 and 1 is passed (0 and 1 included), then a gaussian distribution is used. This will influence the random position along the axis perpendicular to the axis which connects the two circles' centers.

bis_fnc_halo.name: BIS_fnc_halo
bis_fnc_halo.description:
Makes a High Altitude Low Opening (HALO) parachute jump.
> [](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Arma_3)HALO feature is already implemented in Arma 3. Using this function will result in incorrect behaviour and animation.

syntaxArray.Params:
unit: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - the HALO performing unit
altitude: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - (Optional, default 0) altitude added to the unit before HALO

examples:
```sqf
[[player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player)] [call](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/call) BIS_fnc_halo; *// Instantly parachutes the player object*
```

```sqf
[player, 100] call BIS_fnc_halo; *// Increases the altitude of player by 100 before HALO*
```

bis_fnc_convertunits.name: BIS_fnc_convertUnits
bis_fnc_convertunits.description: Converts values to a target system of units.

syntaxArray.Syntax: [value, from, to, mode, precision] call BIS_fnc_convertUnits
syntaxArray.Params:
value: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - source value
from: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - source unit. Can be one of:

* 0: m (meters)

* 1: km (kilometers)

* 2: ms (meters per second)

* 3: kmh (kilometers per hour)

* 4: ft (feet)

* 5: mi (miles)

* 6: fts (feet per second)

* 7: mph (miles per hour)

* 8: nm (nautical miles)

* 9: kts (knots)
to: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - (Optional, default detected system of units *via* [systemOfUnits](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/systemOfUnits)) destination unit. See *from*.
mode: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - (Optional, default 0) can be one of:

* 0: destination value (Scalar)

* 1: destination text long (String) e.g "5 meters"

* 2: destination text short (String) e.g "5 m"
precision: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - (Optional, default 1) destination precision factor, -1 for no precision change. **cannot be 0**

bis_fnc_guihint.name: BIS_fnc_GUIhint
bis_fnc_guihint.description:
/*

	Description:
	Creates advanced hintC dialog

	Parameter(s):
	_this select 0: ARRAY in format
		[text,picture]
			* text: STRING - hint text
			* picture: STRING - picture
		[item1,item2...] - Listbox item ARRAYs in format
			[itemText,itemDescription,picture,icon]
				* itemText: STRING - Text displayed in listbox
				* itemDescription (Optional): STRING - text displayed after clicking on item
				* picture (Optional): STRING - picture displayed after clicking on item
				* icon (Optional): STRING - icon displayed in listbox left from text
	_this select 1 (Optional): STRING - hint header
	_this select 2 (Optional): ARRAY - [STRING,CODE,NUMBER] - text on left button (when "", button is hidden), code executed upon clicking and fade out delay. If only text is present, button is disabled.
	_this select 3 (Optional): ARRAY - [STRING,CODE,NUMBER] - STRING - text on right button and code executed upon clicking
	_this select 4 (Optional): ARRAY - [STRING,CODE,NUMBER] - STRING - text on middle button and code executed upon clicking
	_this select 5 (Optional): NUMBER or ARRAY - width or [width,height] of picture (in grid coordinates). Width > 17 means only picture is used.

	Returns:
	ARRAY - [endState(,lbId)]
		* endState: NUMBER - 1 when clicked on right button, -1 when clicked on left button, 0 when escaped
		* lbId: NUMBER - selected listbox item (when listbox was used)
*/

#define DISPLAY_CLASS	'Hsim_RscDisplayCommonHint_guiHint'
#define DISPLAY_CONFIG	(configfile >> "RscDisplayCommonHint")
#define DISPLAY		(uinamespace getvariable DISPLAY_CLASS)
#define CONTROL		(DISPLAY displayctrl _idc)

#define CONTROL_FADEINTIME	0.3
#define CONTROL_FADEIN \
	CONTROL ctrlsetfade 1; \
	CONTROL ctrlcommit 0; \
	CONTROL ctrlsetfade 0; \
	CONTROL ctrlcommit CONTROL_FADEINTIME;


> 🏗Placeholder description extracted from the function header by [BIS_fnc_exportFunctionsToWiki](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/BIS_fnc_exportFunctionsToWiki).

bis_fnc_createmenu.name: BIS_fnc_createmenu
bis_fnc_createmenu.description:
/*
	File: fn_createMenu.sqf

	Description:
	Create custom commanding menu (with multiple pages if necessary).

	Parameter(s):
		_this select 0 - STRING or ARRAY - Name of menu or [Name, Context sensitive]
		_this select 1 - STRING - Variable in which will be menu params stored (as variable_0, variable_1, ...)
		_this select 2 - ARRAY - Array with menu items (can be either [items] or [[items],[itemNames],[itemEnable]] if you want to set custom params (names, enable values))
		_this select 3 - STRING - Name of submenu which will open when item is activated. Name of selected item is passed to string as %1
		_this select 4 - STRING - Expression which is executed when item is activated. Name of selected item is passed to string as %1, ID is %2.
		_this select 5 - ANYTHING (Optional) - params passed to expression. Whole argument is passed as %3
		_this select 6 - BOOLEAN - False to hide number shortcuts

	Returned value(s):
		True
		
	Example:
	  c = ["first","second"]; ["Menu", "b", c, "","hint 'ahoj'"] call BIS_FNC_createmenu; showCommandingMenu "#USER:b_0"  
	  c = [["firstData","secondData"],["First","Second"]]; ["Menu", "b", c, "","hint (str '%1' + str '%2' + str '%3')"] call BIS_FNC_createmenu;  showCommandingMenu "#USER:b_0";  
	  see news:g7p3po$gik$1@new-server.localdomain
*/
> 🏗Placeholder description extracted from the function header by [BIS_fnc_exportFunctionsToWiki](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/BIS_fnc_exportFunctionsToWiki).

bis_fnc_reviveonbeingrevived.name: BIS_fnc_reviveOnBeingRevived
bis_fnc_reviveonbeingrevived.description: Used to execute specific code locally on every client whenever "being revived" flag changes.
