bis_fnc_destroyer01init.name: BIS_fnc_destroyer01Init
bis_fnc_destroyer01init.description:
/*
	Author: Bravo Zero One development
	- John_Spartan

	Description:
	- This is a main function designed to assemble dynamic ship (multi-part structure). Ship consists of multiple sub-objects that are linked together based on precise memory point positions in 3D space.

	Execution:
	- Call from EH on the main ship's base model (blank model with memory points and reference config).

		Example:
		class Eventhandlers
		{
			init = "_this call bis_fnc_Destroyer01Init";								//main init fnc, will assemble ship in game
			AttributesChanged3DEN = "_this call bis_fnc_Destroyer01EdenInit";			//function to update objects position in EDEN editor if attributes changed by player
			Dragged3DEN = "_this call bis_fnc_Destroyer01PosUpdate";					//function to update objects position in EDEN editor if attributes changed by player
			RegisteredToWorld3DEN = "_this call bis_fnc_Destroyer01EdenInit";			//initial EDEN init fnc (main init is still called)
			UnregisteredFromWorld3DEN = "_this call bis_fnc_Destroyer01EdenDelete";		//function  to delete all ship objects in EDEN editor
		};

	Requirements:
	- Compatible object (carrier/ship) must have a base model with reference memory points and set of parts defined as separate objects in cfgVehicles config with their own models.
	Main ship base must have a definition of all listed sub parts and memory point position to reference it is placement in 3D space.

		Example in cfgVehicles class for ship base
		multiStructureParts[] = {
						{"Land_Destroyer_01_hull_01_F","pos_hull_1"},
						{"Land_Destroyer_01_hull_02_F","pos_hull_2"},
						{"Land_Destroyer_01_hull_03_F","pos_hull_3"},
						{"Land_Destroyer_01_hull_04_F","pos_hull_4"},
						{"Land_Destroyer_01_hull_05_F","pos_hull_5"},
						{"Land_Destroyer_01_interior_02_F","pos_hull_2"},
						{"Land_Destroyer_01_interior_03_F","pos_hull_3"},
						{"Land_Destroyer_01_interior_04_F","pos_hull_4"},
						{"Land_HelipadEmpty_F","pos_heliPad"},
						{"ShipFlag_US_F","pos_Flag"}

					};

	Parameter(s):
		_this select 0: mode (Scalar)
		0: ship Base/object

		and parameters from config

	Returns: exposes and array of objects (ship parts) to other scripts for easy access as variable in it is own object name-space.
	Result: Destroyer (ship) is assembled

*/> 🏗Placeholder description extracted from the function header by [BIS_fnc_exportFunctionsToWiki](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/BIS_fnc_exportFunctionsToWiki).

bis_fnc_drawao.name: BIS_fnc_drawAO
bis_fnc_drawao.description: Draws a dashed line around the outer edges of a trigger.

syntaxArray.Params:
[Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - List of triggers that indicate AO.

* [Trigger](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Triggers) - Single trigger's name that indicates AO. Alternative if only one AO is used.
[Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Number that decides distance between each new line drawn. *(Optional, default 50)*

examples:
```sqf
[Trigger1] call BIS_fnc_drawAO; // Draws a dashed line around trigger1's outer edge, with 50m between each line.
```

```sqf
[Trigger1,10] call BIS_fnc_drawAO; // Draws a dashed line around trigger1's outer edge, with 10m between each line.
```

```sqf
[[Trigger1,Trigger2]] call BIS_fnc_drawAO; // Draws dashed lines around multiple triggers, useful for multiple AOs in one mission.
```

bis_fnc_hudlimits.name: BIS_fnc_HUDLimits
bis_fnc_hudlimits.description:
Set helicopter advanced flight model HUD limits and prevents overwriting existing values. See also [setHUDMovementLevels](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/setHUDMovementLevels).

Notes:

* default value is 0, which means no limits were assigned

* using 0 in min or max value will hide the corresponding limit

* same or higher priority will replace currently set priority

* using a negative priority will reset the values if absolute value is same or higher than current level

syntaxArray.Params:
speedLimit: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) in format [priority, min, max]:

* priority: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number)

* min: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number)

* max: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number)
altLimit: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) in format [priority, min, max]:

* priority: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number)

* min: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number)

* max: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number)
dirLimit: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) in format [priority, min, max, target]:

* priority: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number)

* min: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - you can set a "negative" value by adding 360 (e.g using 270 instead of -90)

* max: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number)

* target: [Position](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Position) or [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - (Optional, default [0,0,0]) the direction relative target

examples:
```sqf
[[0,0,0], [1, 0, 50], [0,0,0]] [call](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/call) BIS_fnc_HUDLimits; *// limits altitude on HUD to 50m max*
```

```sqf
[[0,0,0], [0, 0, 0], [1,330,30, myTarget]] [call](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/call) BIS_fnc_HUDLimits; *// limits orientation towards myTarget by ±30°*
```

bis_fnc_3dencamera.name: BIS_fnc_3DENCamera
bis_fnc_3dencamera.description:
Moves Eden's camera depending on one of two modes:

* "random" - A random position over land preferring non forested areas

* "selected" - The current selected Eden entity or users cursor position if nothing is selected

syntaxArray.Params: **mode**: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Option mode to use

examples:
Move Eden's camera to the currently selected Eden entity

```sqf
["selected"] [call](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/call) BIS_fnc_3DENCamera;
```
Move Eden's camera to a random position

```sqf
["random"] [call](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/call) BIS_fnc_3DENCamera;
```

bis_fnc_exp_camp_manager.name: BIS_fnc_EXP_camp_manager
bis_fnc_exp_camp_manager.description:
/*
	Author: Nelson Duarte

	Description:
	Handles match start synchronization between server and clients

	The following states are valid:
	- Waiting	: State is set when joining the mission
	- Intro		: State is set when mission intro starts
	- Loadout	: State is set when mission loadout selection starts
	- Started	: State is set when mission gameplay starts

	Parameters:
		_introVideos: The videos directory to play, empty array leads to skipping intro videos completely
		_introVideosSubtitles: The subtitles files to execute for intro videos
		_minWaitDelay: The time to wait after waiting has been completed
		_minLoadoutDelay: The time to wait after loadout has been completed
		_maxWaitDelay: The maximum time to wait for all players during the waiting, if reached, mission is forced onto next state
		_maxLoadoutDelay: The maximum time to wait for all players during the loadout, mission is forced onto next state
		_bWantsLoadoutSelection: Whether or not to go into loadout selection, if false this is skipped
		_bNoCinematics: Whether to force no cinematics, these need to be handled manually then

	Returns:
		Nothing
*/> 🏗Placeholder description extracted from the function header by [BIS_fnc_exportFunctionsToWiki](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/BIS_fnc_exportFunctionsToWiki).

bis_fnc_taskhandler.name: BIS_fnc_taskHandler
bis_fnc_taskhandler.description:
/*******************************************************************************
 *
 *	version: 		1.0
 *	name:			Task handler
 *	description:	automatically sets tasks as current 	
 *	parameters:		_this select 0: a unit whose tasks will be handled (Array)
 					_this select 1: links to tasks created via MP Framwork with
 									priorities (loewr number means higher
 									priority)
 *	return value:	none 	
 * 	example:	 	[
 						BIS_cooper,
						[
							["objShaftoe",   		1],
							["objGorka",			3],
							["objNikolayev",		5],
							["objLagushina",   		5],
							["objSmugglers",   		5],
							["objFindBase",    		4],
							["objSentries",   		3],
							["objLeader",			3],
							["objDestroyBase",		3],
							["objEscortLagushina",	1],
							["objRescueCrew",   	2],
							["objSafehouse",    	3],
							["objMaksim",    		6],
							["objEvidence",    		7]
						]
					] call BIS_fnc_taskHandler

 *	TODO:			* generalize so it can be used in WF
 					* add support for standard tasks
 					* randomize the selection of tasks with the same priority
> 🏗Placeholder description extracted from the function header by [BIS_fnc_exportFunctionsToWiki](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/BIS_fnc_exportFunctionsToWiki).

bis_fnc_taskcreate.name: BIS_fnc_taskCreate

syntaxArray.Syntax: [owner, taskID, description, destination, state, priority, showNotification, type, visibleIn3D] call BIS_fnc_taskCreate
syntaxArray.Params:
**owner**: Task owner(s)
[Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - true to set task of all playable units
[Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - set task of a specific object
[Group](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Group) - set tasks of all objects in the group
[Side](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Side) - set tasks of all objects of the given side
[Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - collection of above types
**taskID**:
[String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Task ID
[Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - In the format of [task ID, parent task ID]
**description**:
[Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - Task description in the format ["description", "title", "marker"]
[String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - [CfgTaskDescriptions](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Description.ext#CfgTaskDescriptions) class name, if empty string is used then [CfgTaskDescriptions](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Description.ext#CfgTaskDescriptions) is searched for a class matching the tasks TaskID
**destination** (Optional): Task destination
[Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - Use [objNull](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/objNull) to set no position
[Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - Either position in format [x,y,z], or [object,precision] as used by setSimpleTaskTarget command
**state** (Optional): Task state
[String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - can be one of following:
"CREATED"
"ASSIGNED"
"AUTOASSIGNED" ("ASSIGNED" when no task is assigned yet, otherwise "CREATED")
"SUCCEEDED"
"FAILED"
"CANCELED"
[Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - true to set the task as current
**priority** (Optional): [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - priority. When the current task is completed, the system selects the one with the largest priority >= 0. To avoid auto assignment of that task, give it a priority of -1.
**showNotification** (Optional): [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - true to show notification (default), false to disable it
**type** (Optional): [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - task type from CfgTaskTypes, if not defined, type "" is being used
**visibleIn3D** (Optional): [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - true to make task always visible in 3D (default: false)

bis_fnc_addscriptedeventhandler.name: BIS_fnc_addScriptedEventHandler
bis_fnc_addscriptedeventhandler.description: Adds a Scripted Event Handler and returns its ID. Additionally, the "ScriptedEventHandlerAdded" Scripted EH is called. For the full list of all available Scripted EHs see [Arma 3: Scripted Event Handlers](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3:_Scripted_Event_Handlers).

syntaxArray.Params:
namespace: [Namespace](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Namespace), [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object), [Group](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Group), [Location](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Location), [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean), [Control](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Control) or [Display](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Display) - Namespace in which the EH is stored
name: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Event name
code: [Code](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Code) or [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - The code that is executed when the EH fires
syntaxArray.Return: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - The ID of the new Event Handler

examples:
```sqf
[[true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true), "event", { [hint](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/hint) "Hello World" }] [call](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/call) BIS_fnc_addScriptedEventHandler;
```
 
Boolean will default to [missionNamespace](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/missionNamespace).

bis_fnc_setheight.name: BIS_fnc_setHeight

syntaxArray.Params:
target: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - affected object
height: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - (Optional, default 0) height to set
position: [Position](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Position) - (Optional, default [position](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/position) *target*) position to place the target with calculated height
mode: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - (Optional, default "ROADWAY") can be:

* "ROADWAY": uses [setPos](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/setPos)

* "ASL": uses [setPosASL](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/setPosASL)

* "ATL": uses [setPosATL](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/setPosATL)

syntaxArray.Syntax:
[height, mode] call BIS_fnc_setHeight
> ⚠This syntax uses 
> ```sqf
> [this](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Magic_Variables#this_2)
> ```
>  and is therefore meant to be used in init fields. Not to be used in MP.
syntaxArray.Params:
height: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - (Optional, default 0) height to set
mode: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - (Optional, default "ROADWAY") can be:

* "ROADWAY": uses [setPos](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/setPos)

* "ASL": uses [setPosASL](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/setPosASL)

* "ATL": uses [setPosATL](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/setPosATL)

examples:
```sqf
*// will place player's vehicle on "myHeightMarker", 50m above terrain*
[[vehicle](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/vehicle) [player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player), 50, [getMarkerPos](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/getMarkerPos) "myHeightMarker", "ATL"]]] [call](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/call) BIS_fnc_setHeight;
```

```sqf
*// will set the *this* object 50m above sea level at its position*
*// use where **this** has a value like in an init field*
[50, "ASL"] [call](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/call) BIS_fnc_setHeight;
```

syntaxArray.Syntax: [target, title, idleIcon, progressIcon, conditionShow, conditionProgress, codeStart, codeProgress, codeCompleted, codeInterrupted, arguments, duration, priority, *removeCompleted, showUnconscious, showWindow*] call BIS_fnc_holdActionAdd
syntaxArray.Params:
target: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - Object the action is attached to
title: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Title of the action shown in the action menu.It can contain [Structured Text](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Structured_Text) tags, such as 
```sqf
<t color='#FFAA00'>text</t>
```

idleIcon: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Path of the idle icon shown on screen
progressIcon: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Path of the progress icon shown on screen
conditionShow: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Condition for the action to be shown.
Special arguments passed to the code: _target (action-attached object), _this (caller/executing unit)
conditionProgress: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Condition for the action to progress; if false is returned action progress is paused.
Special arguments passed to the code: _target, _caller, _id, _arguments
codeStart: [Code](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Code) - Code executed when action starts. Passed arguments are:
params ["_target", "_caller", "_actionId", "_arguments"];


* target: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - the object which the action is assigned to

* caller: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - the unit that activated the action

* actionId: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - ID of the activated action (same as ID returned by addAction)

* arguments: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - arguments given to the function
codeProgress: [Code](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Code) - Code executed on every progress tick. Passed arguments are:
params ["_target", "_caller", "_actionId", "_arguments", "_progress", "_maxProgress"];


* target: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - the object which the action is assigned to

* caller: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - the unit that activated the action

* actionId: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - ID of the activated action (same as ID returned by addAction)

* arguments: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - arguments given to the function

* progress: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - currentProgress; progress goes from 1 to 24

* maxProgress: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - max progress (24)
codeCompleted: [Code](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Code) - code executed on completion. Passed arguments are:
params ["_target", "_caller", "_actionId", "_arguments"]; // same as codeStart

codeInterrupted: [Code](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Code) - code executed on interrupted. Passed arguments are: 
params ["_target", "_caller", "_actionId", "_arguments"]; // same as codeCompleted

arguments: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - arguments passed to **codeStart**, **codeProgress**, **codeCompleted** and **codeInterrupted** in format:
params ["_a0","_a1","_a2","_a3","_a4","_a5","_a6","_a7","_a8","_a9","_target","_title","_iconIdle","_iconProgress","_condShow","_condProgress","_codeStart","_codeProgress","_codeCompleted","_codeInterrupted","_duration","_removeCompleted"];
 where 
```sqf
_a0 - _a9
```
 can be custom arguments
duration: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - action duration, a.k.a how much time it takes to complete the action
priority: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - priority value; actions are arranged in descending order according to this value
removeCompleted: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - (Optional, default [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true)) remove on completion
showUnconscious: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - (Optional, default [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false)) show in unconscious state
showWindow: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - (Optional, default [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true)) show on screen; if false action needs to be selected from action menu to appear on screen

examples:
```sqf
[[player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player), "Kill", "", "", "[true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true)", "[true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true)", { [hint](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/hint) "Started!" }, { [systemChat](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/systemChat) [str](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/str) ([_this](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Magic_Variables#this) [select](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/select) 3) }, { [player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player) [setDamage](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/setDamage) 1 }, { [hint](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/hint) "Afraid of death?" }, [], 10, [nil](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/nil), [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true), [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false)] [call](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/call) BIS_fnc_holdActionAdd;
```

```sqf
[
	_myLaptop,											*// Object the action is attached to*
	"Hack Laptop",										*// Title of the action*
	"\a3\ui_f\data\IGUI\Cfg\holdactions\holdAction_connect_ca.paa",	*// Idle icon shown on screen*
	"\a3\ui_f\data\IGUI\Cfg\holdactions\holdAction_connect_ca.paa",	*// Progress icon shown on screen*
	"_this [distance](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/distance) _target < 3",						*// Condition for the action to be shown*
	"_caller [distance](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/distance) _target < 3",						*// Condition for the action to progress*
	{},													*// Code executed when action starts*
	{},													*// Code executed on every progress tick*
	{ _this [call](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/call) MY_fnc_hackingCompleted },				*// Code executed on completion*
	{},													*// Code executed on interrupted*
	[],													*// Arguments passed to the scripts as _this select 3*
	12,													*// Action duration [s]*
	0,													*// Priority*
	[true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true),												*// Remove on completion*
	[false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false)												*// Show in unconscious state*
] [remoteExec](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/remoteExec) ["BIS_fnc_holdActionAdd", 0, _myLaptop];	*// MP compatible implementation*
```

bis_fnc_rounddir.name: BIS_fnc_roundDir
bis_fnc_rounddir.description: Round direction to nearest set rounding; used for determining cardinal direction.

syntaxArray.Params:
rawDirection: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - direction to round
rounding: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - (Optional, default 90) - rounding value. With 90° possible return values are 0, 90, 180 and 270.
syntaxArray.Return: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - rounded direction, depending on input **can be negative or over 360**

examples:
```sqf
[player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player) [setDir](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/setDir) ([[getDir](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/getDir) [player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player), 45] [call](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/call) BIS_fnc_roundDir);
```

```sqf
[204.2, 10] [call](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/call) BIS_fnc_roundDir; *// will return 200*
```

```sqf
[271, 180] [call](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/call) BIS_fnc_roundDir; *// will return 360*
```

```sqf
70 [call](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/call) BIS_fnc_roundDir; *// will return 90*
```

bis_fnc_kbtelllocal.name: BIS_fnc_kbTellLocal
bis_fnc_kbtelllocal.description:
Play given sentence, disable radio and/or lower sounds. Will use [BIS_fnc_showSubtitle](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/BIS_fnc_showSubtitle) for better effects if channel is DIRECT or VEHICLE.
> ⚠This function is intended to be used by [BIS_fnc_kbTell](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/BIS_fnc_kbTell) only.

syntaxArray.Params:
mode: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - can be either "sentence", "conversationStart" or "conversationEnd"
parameters: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - depends on the mode:


* "sentence": same parameters as [kbTell](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/kbTell) (receiver, topicName etc.)


* "conversationStart": [volumeCoef, disableRadio]

* volumeCoef: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - a volume multiplier to reduce other sounds but the chat (0.1 = environment volume set to 10%)

* disableRadio: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - should the radio chat be disabled


* "conversationEnd": [volumeCoefUsedInStart, disableRadioUsedInStart]

* volumeCoefUsedInStart: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - a volume multiplier, shouldn't be used - if < 0 or >= 1, the volume won't be restored

* disableRadioUsedInStart: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - has the radio chat been disabled and should be restored
text - [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String): String to convert to class definition

If the group has other waypoints, the waypoint will be added at the end of the list.

syntaxArray.Params:
group: [Group](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Group)
position: [Position](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Position)

bis_fnc_boatrack01actionremove.name: BIS_fnc_boatRack01ActionRemove
bis_fnc_boatrack01actionremove.description:
/*
	Author: Bravo Zero One development
	- John_Spartan

	Description:
	- This is sub function for 'boat recovery' functionality.

	Execution:
	- Call from trigger that is added to object (boat rack).

	Example:
		"[thisTrigger] call bis_fnc_boatRack01ActionRemove;"

	Required:
		Object (boat rack) must have vehicle in vehicle behavior configured (https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3_Vehicle_in_Vehicle_Transport).
		Object (boat rack) must have triggers set up with continuous actions.

	Parameter(s):
		_this select 0: mode (Scalar)
		0: trigger object
		and
		other parameters from trigger's & players vehicle's names-pace's.

	Returns: nothing
	Result: Continuous action removed from player.

*/> 🏗Placeholder description extracted from the function header by [BIS_fnc_exportFunctionsToWiki](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/BIS_fnc_exportFunctionsToWiki).

bin_fnc_findpath.name: BIN_fnc_findPath
bin_fnc_findpath.description:
/*

	Description:
	A* search algorithm.
	Uses hard-coded Manhattan distance to measure distance.

	Parameter(s):
		0: ARRAY of ARRAYs in format:
			0: NUMBER - node cost
			1: ARRAY - array of neighbor indexes
			2: ARRAY - XYZ position of the node, used to measure distance from end pos
		1: NUMBER - index of starting point
		2: NUMBER - index of ending point

	Returns:
	ARRAY of NUMBERs - indexes of nodes which are traversed on the way to the ending point
*/
> 🏗Placeholder description extracted from the function header by [BIS_fnc_exportFunctionsToWiki](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/BIS_fnc_exportFunctionsToWiki).
 > [](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3_Contact)This content is exclusive to the [Arma 3 Contact](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3_Contact) Expansion.

bis_fnc_setpitchbank.name: BIS_fnc_setPitchBank
bis_fnc_setpitchbank.description:
Rotate an object, giving it the specified pitch and bank, in degrees.
**Pitch** is 0 when the object is level; 90 when pointing straight up; and -90 when pointing straight down.
**Bank** is 0 when level; 90 when the object is rolled to the right, -90 when rolled to the left, and 180 when rolled upside down.
Note that the object's **yaw** can be set with the [setDir](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/setDir) command, which should be issued before using this function, if required.
The pitch/bank can be leveled out (set to 0) by using the [setDir](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/setDir) command.

syntaxArray.Params:
object: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object)
pitch: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number)
Number: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number)

bis_fnc_carrier01posupdate.name: BIS_fnc_carrier01PosUpdate
bis_fnc_carrier01posupdate.description:
/*
	Author: Bravo Zero One development
	- John_Spartan

	Description:
	- This is a sub function designed to update dynamic aircraft carriers position in EDEN editor. Carrier consists of multiple sub-objects that are linked together bnased on precise memory point positions in 3D space.
	Function will update initial object positions when player drggs the object in EDEN editor.

	Exucution:
	- Call from EH on the main carrier base model (blank model with momory points and reference config).

		Example:
		class Eventhandlers
		{
			init = "_this call BIS_fnc_Carrier01Init";								//main init fnc, will assemble carrier in game
			AttributesChanged3DEN = "_this call BIS_fnc_Carrier01EdenInit";			//function to update objects position in EDEN editor if attributes changed by player
			Dragged3DEN = "_this call BIS_fnc_Carrier01PosUpdate";					//function to update objects position in EDEN editor if attributes changed by player
			RegisteredToWorld3DEN = "_this call BIS_fnc_Carrier01EdenInit";			//initial EDEN init fnc (main init is still called)
			UnregisteredFromWorld3DEN = "_this call BIS_fnc_Carrier01EdenDelete";	//function  to delete all carrier objects in EDEN editor
		};

	Requirments:
	- An array of carrier parts/objects as a variable attached to main carrier base. This array is created by main BIS_fnc_Carrier01Init.

	Parameter(s):
		_this select 0: mode (Scalar)
		0: carrier Base/object
		and
		1: array of objects in variable in base objects namespace ["bis_carrierParts", []];


	Returns: nothing
	Result: Aircraft Carrier's possition is updated in EDEN editor.

*/
> 🏗Placeholder description extracted from the function header by [BIS_fnc_exportFunctionsToWiki](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/BIS_fnc_exportFunctionsToWiki).

bis_fnc_showrespawnmenudisableitem.name: BIS_fnc_showRespawnMenuDisableItem
bis_fnc_showrespawnmenudisableitem.description:
Disables respawn loadout, role or position for [Arma 3: Respawn](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3:_Respawn).

* Only role or only loadout can be limited at one moment, if there is limit for both, then only role uses limit.

* If the limit definition for role is called multiple times with different numbers, then the highest number is used.

* If disabling a position then respawnReference must be supplied

syntaxArray.Syntax: [mode, uiControl, listboxItem, message, respawnReference] call BIS_fnc_showRespawnMenuDisableItem;
syntaxArray.Params:
**mode**: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Available options are *disable*, *enable* and *state*
**uiControl**: [Control](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Control) - List in which item should be disabled/enabled

* BIS_RscRespawnControlsMap_ctrlLocList

* BIS_RscRespawnControlsMap_ctrlRoleList

* BIS_RscRespawnControlsMap_ctrlComboLoadout
**listboxItem**: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) or [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Index or name of item in the respawn loadout/role/position listbox
**message**: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Message shown when disabled item is selected, use "" for default message
**respawnReference**: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Reference to respawn position either Marker name or [Object var name](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/vehicleVarName)

examples:
```sqf
[
	"disable",
	uiNamespace getVariable "BIS_RscRespawnControlsMap_ctrlLocList",
	2,
	"Restricted for this part of mission!",
	myRespawnModule [call](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/call) [BIS_fnc_objectVar](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/BIS_fnc_objectVar)
] [call](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/call) BIS_fnc_showRespawnMenuDisableItem;
```

bis_fnc_endmissionserver.name: BIS_fnc_endMissionServer
bis_fnc_endmissionserver.description:
Ends the mission properly for all players in a multiplayer environment.
> ⚠This function is somewhat deprecated. You can [remoteExec](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/remoteExec) [BIS_fnc_endMission](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/BIS_fnc_endMission) instead.

endType: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - class name of ending defined in [CfgDebriefing](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Description.ext#CfgDebriefing).
Can be **custom** or one of dynamically calculated ones:

* "EveryoneWon" - show "MISSION COMPLETED" to everyone

* "EveryoneLost" - show "MISSION FAILED" to everyone

* "SideScore" - show "YOUR SIDE WON" to side with largest score

* "GroupScore" - show "YOUR GROUP WON" to group with largest score

* "PlayerScore" - show "YOU WON" to player with largest score

bis_fnc_missionselector.name: BIS_fnc_missionSelector

syntaxArray.Params:
area: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) of [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - (Optional, default [100,100]) used to determine map's zoom, format [width, height]
mapCenter: [Position2D](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Position2D) - (Optional, default [0,0]) center position where the map camera will be positioned
missionsArray: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - (Optional, default []) list of selectable missions and their parameters, to format [pos, text, tooltip, picture, code]:

* pos: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - where the clickable marker will be placed

* text: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - text that should be displayed next to the icon

* tooltip: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - text to be displayed in the tooltip (on mouse over)

* picture: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - location of the picture to be displayed in the tooltip

* code: [Code](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Code) - code spawned when the icon is clicked

bis_fnc_setppeffecttemplate.name: BIS_fnc_setPPeffectTemplate
bis_fnc_setppeffecttemplate.description: Apply post-process effects according to template from [CfgPostprocessTemplates](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Description.ext#CfgPostprocessTemplates).

syntaxArray.Params:
template: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - (Optional, default "Default") the template name. An invalid value will fall back to "Default".
Available game templates are:

* "Default"

* "BlackAndWhite"

* "Mediterranean"

* "EastWind"

* "RealIsBrown"
transition: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - (Optional, default 0) time to apply the post-process
global: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - (Optional, default true in MP, false in SP) should the post-process be broadcast over the network

examples:
```sqf
["Mediterranean", 3, false] [call](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/call) BIS_fnc_setPPeffectTemplate;
```

```sqf
"RealIsBrown" [call](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/call) BIS_fnc_setPPeffectTemplate;
```

```sqf
"MyPurplePP" [call](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/call) BIS_fnc_setPPeffectTemplate; // can use a template defined in [Description.ext](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Description.ext#CfgPostprocessTemplates)
```

/*

	Description:
	Return all child classes of given class.

	Remark(s):

	Parameter(s):

	Example:

	* 1st way of calling:

	* 2nd way of calling:

		_subclasses = ["Hubs"] call Bis_fnc_getCfgSubClasses;

	Returns:
		ARRAY (of STRINGS with sub-classes names)
*/

bis_fnc_removevirtualmagazinecargo.description: Remove virtual magazines from an object (e.g., ammo box). Virtual items can be selected in the [Arsenal](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arsenal).

object: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - Object from which items will be removed

bis_fnc_tracebullets.name: BIS_fnc_traceBullets
bis_fnc_tracebullets.description:
Visualise unit's bullet trajectories. Can only be used on one shooter in a single instance.
If you want to change the unit, first set 
```sqf
BIS_tracedShooter = [nil](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/nil)
```
 *then* execute the script again.

syntaxArray.Params:
unit: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object)
number: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - (Optional, default 20) maximum displayed trajectories

examples:
```sqf
[[player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player)] [spawn](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/spawn) BIS_fnc_traceBullets;
```

```sqf
[[player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player), 50] [spawn](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/spawn) BIS_fnc_traceBullets;
```

```sqf
[[player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player), 0] [spawn](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/spawn) BIS_fnc_traceBullets; *// remove bullet tracing*
```

bis_fnc_limitammunition.name: BIS_fnc_limitAmmunition
bis_fnc_limitammunition.description:
Limits the number of magazines carried by individual unit. Each container (uniform, vest and backpack) can be limited separately or left untouched.
	The function limits the number of magazines of each unique ammo category in respective container. Items like First Aid Kit or Mine Detector are not affected by the functionSet the minimum and maximum values in an array, for example [0.5,1] will set the magazine count anywhere between 50-100% of default count.

syntaxArray.Params:
unit: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object)
uniformMags: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - (Optional, default [0.4,0.8]) Amount of magazines in uniform. Array in form:

* 0:minMags - Minimum amount of magazines in percent (%)

* 1:maxMags - Maximum amount of magazines in percent (%)
vestMags: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - (Optional, default [0.4,0.8]) Amount of magazines in vest. Array in form:

* 0:minMags - Minimum amount of magazines in percent (%)

* 1:maxMags - Maximum amount of magazines in percent (%)
backpackMags: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - (Optional, default [0.4,0.8]) Amount of magazines in backpack. Array in form:

* 0:minMags - Minimum amount of magazines in percent (%)

* 1:maxMags - Maximum amount of magazines in percent (%)

color: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - (Optional, default [1,0,1,1]) [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) in format [R,G,B,A]
draw: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - (Optional, default nil) [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) to draw, [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false) to remove

bis_fnc_vrtimer.name: BIS_fnc_VRTimer
bis_fnc_vrtimer.description:
Timer for VR and time trials. The following [missionNamespace](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/missionNamespace) variables can be used:

* BIS_stopTimer: set to [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) to stop the timer. Once stopped, the function must be executed again to restart the timer

* RscFiringDrillTime_current: fill with [Structured Text](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Structured_Text) to display text instead of timer (when timer is stopped)

* RscFiringDrillTime_done: set to [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) to close the display. ***Stop the timer first***

syntaxArray.Params:
colour: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) (Optional, default 
```sqf
(["IGUI", "WARNING_RGB"] [call](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/call) [BIS_fnc_displayColorGet](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/BIS_fnc_displayColorGet)) [call](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/call) [BIS_fnc_colorRGBtoHTML](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/BIS_fnc_colorRGBtoHTML)
```
) timer colour in HTML format (#RRGGBB)

bis_fnc_bitwisexor.name: BIS_fnc_bitwiseXOR
bis_fnc_bitwisexor.description:
Performs bitwise XOR operation on two decimal or hexadecimal unsigned 24 bit integers (Hexadecimal number representation is simply auto-converted into decimal by the engine)
**Limitations**:
Due to various limitations of the Real Virtuality engine this function is 
intended to work with unsigned 24 bit integers only. This means that the 
supported range is 2^0...2^24 (1...16777216)

syntaxArray.Params:
num1: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - decimal or hexadecimal unsigned 24 bit integer
num2: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - decimal or hexadecimal unsigned 24 bit integer

bis_fnc_kbcreatedummy.name: BIS_fnc_kbCreateDummy

syntaxArray.Params: dummyVarName: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - can be anything, but if an identity from [CfgIdentities](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Description.ext#CfgIdentities) the dummy will take this identity.

examples:
```sqf
[private](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/private) _dummySpeaker = "BIS_dummySpeaker" [call](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/call) BIS_fnc_kbCreateDummy; *// _dummySpeaker == BIS_dummySpeaker now*
```

```sqf
[private](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/private) _dummySpeaker = "Miller" [call](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/call) BIS_fnc_kbCreateDummy; *// given **Miller** is defined in [CfgIdentities](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Description.ext#CfgIdentities)*
```

bis_fnc_vectordivide.name: BIS_fnc_vectorDivide
bis_fnc_vectordivide.description:
Divides vector by scalar, by dividing all vector elements.
> ⓘ[vectorMultiply](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/vectorMultiply) can be used instead as 
> ```sqf
> vector [vectorMultiply](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/vectorMultiply) 1/scale
> ```
> , but:
> 
> * *scale* cannot be 0
> 
> * in some rare cases, the result is not *exactly* the same as BIS_fnc_vectorDivide - this is due to [Floating Point Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Floating_Point_Number) precision and rounding.

syntaxArray.Params:
vector: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) of [Numbers](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - (Optional, default [0,0,0]) can be any array of numbers.
divider: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - (Optional, default 1)

bis_fnc_reviveonstate.name: BIS_fnc_reviveOnState
bis_fnc_reviveonstate.description:
/*
	Author: Jiri Wainar

	Description:
	Used to execute specific code localy on every client whenever unit's state changes.

	Parameters:
		_this select 0: STRING - Variable that carries the state value over the network, defined by macro VAR_TRANSFER_STATE.
		_this select 1: SCALAR - State.
		_this select 2: OBJECT - Unit to set the status for.


	Returns:
	True if successful, false if not.

	States:
		#define STATE_RESPAWNED			0
		#define STATE_REVIVED			1
		#define STATE_INCAPACITATED		2
		#define STATE_DEAD				3
*/> 🏗Placeholder description extracted from the function header by [BIS_fnc_exportFunctionsToWiki](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/BIS_fnc_exportFunctionsToWiki).

bis_fnc_configpath.name: BIS_fnc_configPath
bis_fnc_configpath.description: Returns config path to given entry in given format.

syntaxArray.Params:
config: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array), [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) or [Config](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Config) - input config
format (Optional): [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array), [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) or [Config](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Config) - desired format of output. Default: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array), unless [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) is input, then [Config](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Config) is returned (see Example 1)
strict (Optional): [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - by default the function will not attempt to construct a valid config before certain format conversions (see Example 2). Set this param to [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) to invoke the strict mode

examples:
```sqf
["configFile >> ""CfgVehicles"" >> ""Car"""] [call](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/call) BIS_fnc_configPath; *// ["configFile","CfgVehicles","Car"]*
```

```sqf
[["mary", "had", "a", "little", "lamb"], ""] [call](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/call) BIS_fnc_configPath; *// "mary >> ""had"" >> ""a"" >> ""little"" >> ""lamb"""*
```

```sqf
[["configFile","CfgVehicles","Car"]] [call](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/call) BIS_fnc_configPath; *// bin\config.cpp/CfgVehicles/Car*
```

```sqf
["bin\config.cpp/CfgVehicles/Car"] [call](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/call) BIS_fnc_configPath; *// ["configFile","CfgVehicles","Car"]*
```

```sqf
[configFile >> "CfgVehicles" >> "Car", ""] [call](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/call) BIS_fnc_configPath; *// "configFile >> ""CfgVehicles"" >> ""Car"""*
```

```sqf
["bin\config.cpp/CfgVehicles/Car", "", [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true)] [call](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/call) BIS_fnc_configPath; *// "configFile >> ""CfgVehicles"" >> ""Car"""*
```

```sqf
["bin\config.cpp/CfgVehicles/Car", ""] [call](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/call) BIS_fnc_configPath; *// "bin\config.cpp/CfgVehicles/Car"*
```

```sqf
[["mary", "had", "a", "little", "lamb"], "", [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true)] [call](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/call) BIS_fnc_configPath; *// "" invalid config*
```

bis_fnc_establishingshot.name: BIS_fnc_establishingShot
bis_fnc_establishingshot.description: Plays a fake UAV observational sequence which serves as an establishing shot. [](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/File:BIS_fnc_establishingShot.gif)

syntaxArray.Syntax: [target, text, altitude, radius, angle, rotation, iconOptions, mode, fadeIn,waitTime] spawn BIS_fnc_establishingShot
syntaxArray.Params:
target: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) or [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - Target or target's position
text: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - (Optional, default "") Text to display
altitude: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - (Optional, default 500) Altitude in meters
radius: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - (Optional, default 200) Radius of the circular movement in meters
angle: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - (Optional, default random) Viewing angle in degrees
rotation: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - (Optional, default random) Direction of camera movement 

* 0: anti-clockwise

* 1: clockwise
iconOptions: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - (Optional, default []) Each array in format:

* 0: icon: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Path to icon texture

* 1: color: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - Color in format [R,G,B,A]

* 2: target: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object), [Position](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Position) or [Group](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Group) - Where the texture should be drawn

* 3: sizeX: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - (Optional, default 1) Size of icon in x

* 4: sizeY: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - (Optional, default 1) Size of icon in y

* 5: angle: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - (Optional, default [random](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/random) 360) Angle of icon

* 6: text: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - (Optional, default "") Text displayed underneath the icon

* 7: shadow: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - (Optional, default 0)

* 0 to draw now shadow

* 1 to draw a shadow
mode: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - (Optional, default 0) 

* 0: normal (Disables saving and sets BIS_missionStarted to [nil](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/nil))

* 1: world scenes
fadeIn: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - (Optional, default [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true)) Fade in after completion
waitTime: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - (Optional, default 2) Wait time in seconds after the shot has been completed *Since Arma 3 v1.81*

examples:
```sqf
[[player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player), "I can see my house from here", 500, 250, 75, 1, [], 0, [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true)] [spawn](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/spawn) BIS_fnc_establishingShot;
```

```sqf
[
  [5229.97,5233.07,0],
  "BLUFOR and OPFOR firefight",
  500,
  250,
  75,
  1,
  [
     ["\A3\ui_f\data\map\markers\nato\b_inf.paa",[0,0.3,0.6,1],group_1,1,1,0,"BLUFOR"],
     ["\A3\ui_f\data\map\markers\nato\o_inf.paa",[0.5,0,0,1],group_2,1,1,0,"OPFOR"]
  ],
  0,
  [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true),
  15
] [spawn](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/spawn) BIS_fnc_establishingShot;
```

bis_fnc_bitflagsset.name: BIS_fnc_bitflagsSet
bis_fnc_bitflagsset.description:
Sets one or more flags in the given flagset, represented with decimal or hexadecimal number
(Hexadecimal number representation is simply auto-converted into decimal by the engine)
To check which flags are present in given flagset use [BIS_fnc_bitflagsToArray](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/BIS_fnc_bitflagsToArray)
**Limitations**:
Due to various limitations of the Real Virtuality engine this function is 
intended to work with unsigned 24 bit integers only. This means that the 
supported range is 2^0...2^24 (1...16777216)

syntaxArray.Params:
flagset: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - flagset
flag: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - one or more flags to set
syntaxArray.Return: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number)  - new flagset with given flag or flags set

bis_fnc_clerp.name: BIS_fnc_clerp
bis_fnc_clerp.description:
CLerp - Circular Lerp - is like lerp but handles the wraparound from 0 to 360
 This is useful when interpolating eulerAngles and the object crosses the 0/360 boundary
 The standard Lerp function causes the object to rotate in the wrong direction, clerp fixes that

syntaxArray.Params:
currentValue: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - The current value
targetValue: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - The target value
alpha: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - The alpha

bis_fnc_managecuratorchallenges.name: BIS_fnc_manageCuratorChallenges
bis_fnc_managecuratorchallenges.description:
Handle repeated curator challenges.
	When rewards defined in the argument are exceeded, refilling points bar fill be offered instead.

syntaxArray.Params:
curator [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - Curator
challenges [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - (Optional, default all challenges) List of supported challenges from CfgCuratorChallenges
challenges [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - (Optional, default 3) Number of added challenges
rewards [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) of [arrays](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - (Optional, default []) Rewards and their descriptions in format:

* 0: [Code](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Code) - Code executed

* 1: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Description
defaultRewards [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) of [arrays](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - (Optional, default []) Default reward, used when previous rewards are exausted  in format:

* 0: [Code](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Code) - Code executed

* 1: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Description

bis_fnc_colormarker.name: BIS_fnc_colorMarker
bis_fnc_colormarker.description: Changes color of a marker with a little effect

syntaxArray.Params:
marker: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Marker
color: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Color from CfgMarkerColors
duration: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - (Optional, default 1) Duration of the transition

mode: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - **case-sensitive**, can be one of "SET", "ADD", "MODIFY", "KILLED"
depending on *mode*:

* "SET" - set respect default values

* param1: [Nothing](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Nothing) or [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) (see **Return value**)

* "ADD" - add respect values depending on global town respect

* param1: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - unit to which is given respect from assigned town with random difference defined in third argument

* param2: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - range of random difference

* "MODIFY" - change given respect value

* param1: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - unit of which respect value will be changed

* param2: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - [faction](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/faction) of which respect will be changed

* param3: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - [code](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Code) which defines formula for change (current respect value is stored in variable _r) - e.g. "_r / 2"

* "KILLED" - modify global town respect after civilian has been killed

* param1: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - killer

* param2: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - town logic

* param3: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - change coefficient
syntaxArray.Return:
* "SET": [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) with zero respect values  (if [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) is passed as argument, 1 is on place of object's faction)

* "ADD": unit's respect values

* "MODIFY": modified respect value

* "KILLED": modified town respect value

bis_fnc_initvehicle.name: BIS_fnc_initVehicle
bis_fnc_initvehicle.description:
This function changes the textures, animation sources and/or mass of a given vehicle.

* Unless explicitly mentioned , the function will restore the initial state of every animation sources of the given object (**Example 3**).

syntaxArray.Params:
vehicle: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - vehicle to customize
variant: (Optional, default [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false))

* [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) to restore default texture source, [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false) to skip texture source change

* [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - Array of texture sources with their probability, to format 
```sqf
["textureSource1", 0.5, "textureSource2", 0.5]
```


* [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Variant class name - from the [configFile](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/configFile) >> [CfgVehicles](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/CfgVehicles) or from the [missionConfigFile](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/missionConfigFile) >> [CfgVehicleTemplates](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Description.ext#CfgVehicleTemplates)

* [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - index of the texture source (same as the old system)
animations: (Optional, default [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false))

* [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) to restore init phase of every animation sources

* [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - Array of animation sources with their probability, to format 
```sqf
["animationSource1", 0.5, "animationSource2", 0.5]
```

> ⚠If the first element is wrong, it will skip the rest of the animation sources!

* [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - variant class name - from the [configFile](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/configFile) >> [CfgVehicles](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/CfgVehicles) or from the [missionConfigFile](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/missionConfigFile) >> [CfgVehicleTemplates](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Description.ext#CfgVehicleTemplates)
mass: (Optional, default [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false))

* [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) to set the default mass, [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false) to disable the mass change

* [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - mass to remove/add to the vehicle

examples:
```sqf
result = [[this](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Magic_Variables#this_2), "", []] [call](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/call) BIS_fnc_initVehicle;
```

```sqf
result = [[this](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Magic_Variables#this_2), ["MyTextureSource1", 0.5, "MyTextureSource2", 0.6], []] [call](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/call) BIS_fnc_initVehicle;
```

```sqf
result = [[this](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Magic_Variables#this_2), [nil](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/nil), ["MyAnimationSource1", 0.5, "MyAnimationSource2", 0.7]] [call](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/call) BIS_fnc_initVehicle;
```

```sqf
*// Randomise camo net options with 50% probability*
[[vehicle](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/vehicle) [player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player), [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false), ["showcamonethull", 0.5, "showcamonetturret", 0.5, "showcamonetcannon", 0.5, "showslathull", 0.5]] [call](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/call) BIS_fnc_initVehicle;
```

```sqf
*// Force show all camo net options. Use [animationNames](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/animationNames) to get all available animation sources. Vehicles that don't support certain animations are simply ignored.*
[[vehicle](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/vehicle) [player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player), [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false), ["showcamonethull", 1, "showcamonetturret", 1, "showcamonetcannon", 1, "showslathull", 1]] [call](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/call) BIS_fnc_initVehicle;

```

bis_fnc_addvirtualitemcargo.name: BIS_fnc_addVirtualItemCargo
bis_fnc_addvirtualitemcargo.description: Add virtual items to an object (e.g., ammo box). Virtual items can be selected in the [Arsenal](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arsenal).

syntaxArray.Params:
object: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - Object to which items will be added

bis_fnc_objectsgrabber.name: BIS_fnc_objectsGrabber
bis_fnc_objectsgrabber.description:
Converts a set of placed objects to an object array (**as a [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String)**) for the [DynO mapper](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/BIS_fnc_objectsMapper).
Format is the following. First, the header:

```sqf
/*
Grab data:
Mission: TheMissionName
World: Stratis
Anchor position: [3781.59, 3289.67]
Area size: 50
Using orientation of objects: yes/no
*/
```


Then, data:

```sqf
[
	["B_UAV_01_F",[-5.23706,-0.183594,-0.00126648],167.39,1,0,[0.605018,-0.575293],"","",true,false], 
	["C_Offroad_01_F",[-4.25903,4.62158,0.0630951],224.14,1,0,[0.812812,0.190543],"","",true,false]
]
```


or, if object orientation is not used:

```sqf
[
	["B_UAV_01_F",[-5.23706,-0.183594,-0.00126648],167.39,1,0,[],"","",true,false], 
	["C_Offroad_01_F",[-4.25903,4.62158,0.0630951],224.14,1,0,[],"","",true,false]
]
```

syntaxArray.Params:
position: [Position](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Position) - (Optional, default [0,0]) 2D or 3D position, center of the "grabbing" area
size: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - (Optional, default 50) size (radius) of the "grabbing" area
objectOrientation: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - (Optional, default [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false)) capture object orientation or not. Format [BIS_fnc_getPitchBank](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/BIS_fnc_getPitchBank)

bis_fnc_codeperformance.name: BIS_fnc_codePerformance
bis_fnc_codeperformance.description:
[](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/File:BIS_fnc_codePerformance.png)Measures how much time it takes to execute given expression. Results may vary based on overall performance; use this function to compare alternative scripting approaches rather than to measure specific values. Upon function execution, window with results is opened. The user then has a choice to copy the result into clipboard or not. 
This function is using [diag_codePerformance](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/diag_codePerformance) command.


Keep in mind that this takes string, and that you can't pass 
```sqf
[str](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/str) _code
```
 as string because that add's curly braces to the string.

syntaxArray.Params:
expression: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Tested expression
arguments (Optional): [Anything](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Anything) - Arguments to pass into the code.  Default: []
cycles (Optional): [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Number of wanted cycles. Default: 10000
display (Optional): [Display](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Display) - Display in which the message window with results will be opened. Use [displayNull](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/displayNull) to disable the window. Default: Current mission display
syntaxArray.Return: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Average execution time of the expression

bis_fnc_modulecovermap.name: BIS_fnc_moduleCoverMap
bis_fnc_modulecovermap.description:
Covers the map except a defined area to highlight the area of operation. Works on dedicated server. This function was designed to be used by the [Modules framework](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Modules), but it can also be used without the module. The effect does not move with the centerObject.It is essential for the function to work that **centerObject** has the variable **objectArea** defined.

```sqf
centerObject [setVariable](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/setVariable) ["objectArea",[sizeX,sizeY,rotation]]
```


* centerObject [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - Object which is used as center

* sizeX: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) -  Length in x in meters

* sizeY: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Length in y in meters

* roation: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Rotation of the rectangle in degree
[](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/File:BIS_fnc_moduleCoverMap.jpg)

syntaxArray.Params:
centerUnit: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - Object which is used as center
units: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - **Not used inside the function**
init: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) to create cover map effect, [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false) to remove all markers and destroy the effect

bis_fnc_unitplaysimple.name: BIS_fnc_unitPlaySimple
bis_fnc_unitplaysimple.description: Plays back input movement data on input unit. Simplified.

syntaxArray.Syntax: [unit, data, varDone, stateIngnore, debug, sleep, skipTime] spawn BIS_fnc_unitPlaySimple
syntaxArray.Params:
unit: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - Unit to play movement data on
data: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - Movement data to use
varDone: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - (Optional, default []) Variable to set on specified Object once playback has finished in format:

* 0: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object), [Group](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Group) or [Namespace](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Namespace) - Target

* 1: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Variable name
stateIgnore: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - (Optional, default [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false)) Whether to ignore if the Unit is dead and/or cannot move
debug: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - (Optional, default [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false) Whether to give debug information on played frames per second
sleep: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - (Optional, default 0) Time to Sleep between frames. This is if you want to be recording another unit and playing back movement data on another as well. Limit is 0-1 seconds.
skipTime: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - (Optional, default 0) Amount of time to skip at the start of playback. For example if you wish to play the data from halfway instead of the start.

bis_fnc_unitcapturesimple.name: BIS_fnc_unitCaptureSimple
bis_fnc_unitcapturesimple.description:
Records movement data of input unit over a specified period of time. Simplified.
Pressing the Esc key, the duration ending, or the unit dying ends the recording.
Copies to clipboard an [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) in format [frameTime, unitPosition, unitDirection] for each frame.

syntaxArray.Params:
unit: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - Unit to capture movement data from
duration: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - Duration to capture for
FPS: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - (Optional, default 20) Frames recorded per second (default 20). Limit is 1 - 100
Firing: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - (Optional, default [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false))  If [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true), will record the input unit's weapon fire data as well
startTime: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - (Optional, default 0) Starting time offset for the frame time

bis_fnc_boatrack01canprogressaction.description:
/*
	Author: Bravo Zero One development
	- John_Spartan

	Description:
	- This is sub function for 'boat recovery' functionality.

	Execution:
	- Call from script that invokes the "Hold Action" for boat recovery.

	Example:
		[_target,_boatRack] call bis_fnc_boatRack01CanProgressAction;

	Required:
		Object (boat)
		Object (boat rack) must have vehicle in vehicle behavior configured (https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3_Vehicle_in_Vehicle_Transport).

	Parameter(s):
		_this select 0: mode (Scalar)
		0: Object (boat)
		1: Object (boat rack)

	Returns: true if all conditions are met during the process of "Hold Action", can continue with action
	Result: Check to allow continue with "Hold Action".

*/> 🏗Placeholder description extracted from the function header by [BIS_fnc_exportFunctionsToWiki](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/BIS_fnc_exportFunctionsToWiki).

bis_fnc_spawncrew.name: BIS_fnc_spawnCrew
bis_fnc_spawncrew.description:
Function to fill all crew positions in a vehicle, including turrets.
	In dummy mode no objects are created and the returned array contains only ones.
	In this mode the function can be used to count the actual crew of an existing vehicle or vehicle type.

syntaxArray.Params:
vehicle: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - Vehicle
group: [Group](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Group) - Crew's group
dummyMode: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - (Optional, default [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false)) [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) to enable dummy mode
dummyType: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - (Optional, default "") Dummy type
crewType: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - (Optional, default "") Crew type
syntaxArray.Return: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) or [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Created crew objects or crew count

bis_fnc_spawnobjects.name: BIS_fnc_spawnObjects
bis_fnc_spawnobjects.description: Create a stack of objects at given position or on top of given object (eg. table).

syntaxArray.Syntax: [position, className, count, offsetMatrix, offsetDir, dirNoise, enableSimulation] call BIS_fnc_spawnObjects
syntaxArray.Params:
position: [PositionASL](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/PositionASL), or [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) as [referenceObject, placement]

* referenceObject: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object)

* placement: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - can be:

* "BOTTOM" = at the bottom of the object

* "TOP" = top of the objects boundingbox

* "GROUND" = sitting just on the ground

* "ROADWAY" = sitting just on the ground
className: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - class of the object(s) to spawn; all will use the same class
count: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) (Optional, default: 1) - how many objects will be spawned
offsetMatrix: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) (Optional, default: [0,0,0]) - starting spawning position offset
offsetDir: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) (Optional, default: 0) - starting spawning direction offset
dirNoise: [Code](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Code) (Optional, default: {0}) - spawned object direction delta from the starting direction, defined as code returning dir delta value
enableSimulation: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) (Optional, default: false) - shall the simulation of the spawned objects be enabled or not

bis_fnc_vrdrawgrid.name: BIS_fnc_VRDrawGrid
bis_fnc_vrdrawgrid.description:
Visualizes surface grid (used primarily for VR missions).
> ⓘOnly one instance of grid visualisation can run at any given time. Calling this function multiple times will only move the grid center.

syntaxArray.Params:
location: [Position](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Position) or [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean):

* [Position](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Position): center position (should be multiple of 4 in both axis to correspond with the tiles on the ground, like [1000,1000] or [2400,2400])

* [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean): use [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false) to disable grid visualisation
colour: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - (Optional, default [0,0,0,1]) to format [R,G,B,A]

classes: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) of [Strings](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - (Optional, default 
```sqf
[]
```

bis_fnc_diagaar.name: BIS_fnc_diagAAR

Fill an **AAR** (After Action Review) display with data and Event Handlers.
> ⚠[BIS_fnc_diagAARrecord](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/BIS_fnc_diagAARrecord) **must** have been previously executed to have data to display.

syntaxArray.Params:
mode: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - can be one of:

* "Init" - Fill display with AAR data

* "Init_List" - *internal function usage*

* "Display_keydown" - *internal function usage*

* "Timeline_sliderposchanged" - *internal function usage*

* "ListMissions_lbselchanged" - *internal function usage*

* "ListSessions_lbselchanged" - *internal function usage*

* "draw" - *internal function usage*
arguments:

* "Init" arguments: [display]: [Display](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Display)

* "Init_List" arguments: [display]: [Display](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Display)

* "Display_keydown" arguments: see [onKeyDown](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/User_Interface_Event_Handlers#onKeyDown) event

* "Timeline_sliderposchanged" arguments: see [onSliderPosChanged](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/User_Interface_Event_Handlers#onSliderPosChanged) event

* "ListMissions_lbselchanged" arguments: see [onLBSelChanged](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/User_Interface_Event_Handlers#onLbSelChanged) event

* "ListSessions_lbselchanged" arguments: see [onLBSelChanged](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/User_Interface_Event_Handlers#onLbSelChanged) event

* "draw" arguments: see [onDraw](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/User_Interface_Event_Handlers#onDraw) event

bis_fnc_encodeflags8.name: BIS_fnc_encodeFlags8
bis_fnc_encodeflags8.description:
/*
	Encodes array of unique 8-state flags (0,1,2,3,4,5,6,7) into a single number.

	Syntax:
	-------
	_encodedFlags:scalar = _flags:array call bis_fnc_encodeFlags8;

	Example:
	--------
	4311 = [7,2,3,0,1] call bis_fnc_encodeFlags8;

	Explanation:
	------------
	[7,2,3,0,1] -> 001 000 011 010 111 -> 0001 0000 1101 0111 -> 4311
*/> 🏗Placeholder description extracted from the function header by [BIS_fnc_exportFunctionsToWiki](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/BIS_fnc_exportFunctionsToWiki).

bis_fnc_ftlmanager.name: BIS_fnc_FTLmanager
bis_fnc_ftlmanager.description:
**FTL** (**F**riendly **T**o **L**ocal) manager tracks relationship between player and civilian side.
**FTL State** can be one of the following: "LOW", "NEUTRAL", "HIGH". See [FriendlyToLocal System](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/FriendlyToLocal_System).

syntaxArray.Params:
functionCalled: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - One of the following:

* "Init" - initialises the FTL managerReturn: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - FTL State

* "Destroy" - destroys the current FTL manager instanceReturn:

* "GetFTLState" - returns current FTL stateReturn: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - FTL state: "LOW", "NEUTRAL" or "HIGH"

* "SetFTLState" - computes and sets the new FTLValue and FTLState afterwardsReturn:

* "GetNearestTownRespect" - Returns nearest (in 500m radius) town respect for playerReturn: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - respect
type: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Can be one of the following:

* "sysUpdate" (internal use)

* "NONE" (no change)

* "CivKilled" (-0.5)

* "VIPCivKilled" (-0.7)

* "RebelKilled" (-0.3)

* "TaskSmallRefused" (-0.05)

* "TaskSmallDone" (+0.4)

* "TaskSmallFailed" (-0.4)

* "TaskGreatRefused" (-0.1)

* "TaskGreatDone" (+0.6)

* "TaskGreatFailed" (-0.6)

* "CivHouseDestroyed" (-0.5)

* "GreatHouseDestroyed" (-0.8)
syntaxArray.Return: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false) if the manager is not initialised yet

bis_fnc_unpackstaticweapon.name: BIS_fnc_unpackStaticWeapon
bis_fnc_unpackstaticweapon.description:
This function will move given support team to the given weapon position. The weapon crew will unpack carried weapon and start watching given target position. Requires three personnel in the team: Team Leader, Gunner and Asst. Gunner. This function is MP compatible.

 When weapon is unpacked, scripted EH "StaticWeaponUnpacked" is called with the following params: 

* [group, leader, gunner, assistant, weapon]

> ⓘIf a unit flees, all bets are off and the function will exit leaving units on their own. To guarantee weapon disassembly, make sure the group has maximum courage 
> ```sqf
> _group [allowFleeing](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/allowFleeing) 0;
> ```
>

syntaxArray.Params:
group: [Group](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Group) or [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - the support team group or a unit from this group
weaponPos: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array), [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) or [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - weapon placement position, object position or marker
targetPos: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array), [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) or [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - target position, object position to watch or marker
leaderPos (Optional):  [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array), [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) or [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - position, object or marker group leader should move to

bis_fnc_respawntickets.name: BIS_fnc_respawnTickets
bis_fnc_respawntickets.description:
Manage respawn tickets used by *[Tickets](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3_Respawn#Respawn_Templates)* respawn template.

When player dies, number of tickets is decreased by 1. The most local tickets are always used. Example: When you first add tickets to player's side, they will be affected. If you later define tickets also to player's group, they will completely replace the side tickets.

When player runs out of the tickets, his respawn is disabled. If you use also *EndMission* respawn template, the mission will automatically end once tickets in all name spaces are exhausted.

syntaxArray.Return:
**target**: Receiver of the respawn tickets
[Namespace](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Namespace) - use [missionNamespace](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/missionNamespace) to set/get global tickets available for everyone
[Side](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Side)
[Group](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Group)
[Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object)
[Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - remaining tickets in all name spaces

examples:
Add 5 tickets for BLUFOR

```sqf
[[west](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/west), 5] [call](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/call) BIS_fnc_respawnTickets;
```
Return number of global tickets

```sqf
globalTickets = [[missionNamespace](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/missionNamespace)] [call](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/call) BIS_fnc_respawnTickets;
```
Return number of player's tickets

```sqf
playerTickets = [[player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player),[nil](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/nil),[true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true)] [call](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/call) BIS_fnc_respawnTickets;
```

bis_fnc_drawarrow.name: BIS_fnc_drawArrow
bis_fnc_drawarrow.description:
Draws a static arrow (outline or color filled) on map. See Example 4 for arrow removal.
> ⓘNote that the order in which arrows are added to map is reversed, the last added arrow will appear under the first added arrow

syntaxArray.Syntax: [from, to, color, pars, fill, map] call BIS_fnc_drawArrow
syntaxArray.Params:
from: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - Arrow start position in format [x,y] or [x,y,z]
to: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - Arrow end position in format [x,y] or [x,y,z]
color (Optional): [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - Arrow line or fill color in format [r,g,b,a]. Default: [1,1,1,1]
pars (Optional): [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - Arrow geometry details in format [arrowThickness, arrowHeadLengthCoef, arrowHeadWidthCoef], where:

* arrowThickness (Optional):  [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Arrow thickness in meters. Default: 10

* arrowHeadLengthCoef (Optional):  [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Arrow head length compared to the total length of the arrow. Default: 1/3 (third of the length)

* arrowHeadWidthCoef (Optional):  [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Arrow head width compared to the arrow thickness. Default: 2 (twice as wide)

* arrowBaseWidthCoef (Optional):  [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Arrow base width compared to the arrow thickness. Default: 1 (same width)  - *Since Arma 3 v1.97*
fill (Optional): [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) to draw color filled arrow, [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false) to draw outline. Default: [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true)
map (Optional): [Control](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Control) - Map control. Default: [control](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/displayCtrl) 51 of the main map [display](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/findDisplay) 12
syntaxArray.Return:
[Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - Arrow reference for removal in format [idd, idc, ehId] or empty array [] on removal operation

[](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/File:fnc_drawArrow.jpg) [](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/File:BIS_fnc_drawArrow2.jpg)
