bis_fnc_intrigger.name: BIS_fnc_inTrigger
bis_fnc_intrigger.description: Detects whether position is within area (Since Arma 3 v1.57 an engine solution is available [inArea](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/inArea)) **or** calculates distance to the nearest edge of trigger area by using optional params.

syntaxArray.Params:
area: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - trigger, [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - marker, [Location](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Location) - location or [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - in format [center, distance] or [center, [a, b, angle, rect]] or [center, [a, b, angle, rect, height]]
position: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) or [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - Position to check (e.g. player) or [Position](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Position)
returnDistance (Optional): [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) to return distance to nearest edge of trigger area. Default: [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false)
includeFloorCeiling (Optional): [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) to include trigger area floor and ceiling in calculation when calculating distance to nearest edge. Default: [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false)
syntaxArray.Return:
[Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) when position is in area, false if not

**or**
[Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - (when *returnDistance* is [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true)) - distance from closest border: negative distance - from inside, positive distance - from outside

bis_fnc_runlater.name: BIS_fnc_runLater
bis_fnc_runlater.description: Stack code/function that should be run later, after some time/frames or/and custom condition. Internally calls [BIS_fnc_loop](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/BIS_fnc_loop).

syntaxArray.Syntax: [id, code, timer, timerType, condition] call BIS_fnc_runLater;
syntaxArray.Params:
id: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Unique Id
code: [Code](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Code) or [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Code/function that is executed later
timer: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - The timer value (can be in seconds or frames)
timerType: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - can be "seconds" or "frames"
condition: [Code](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Code) - The custom condition, code is only executed if timer is validated and condition is met

examples:
```sqf
*// Hints current game time in the next frame after 5 seconds have passed*
["uniqueId", { [hint](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/hint) [str](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/str) [time](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/time); }, 5] [call](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/call) BIS_fnc_runLater;
```

```sqf
*// Hints current game time in the next frame after 120 frames have passed*
["uniqueId", { [hint](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/hint) [str](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/str) [time](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/time); }, 120, "frames"] [call](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/call) BIS_fnc_runLater;
```

```sqf
*// Hints current game time in the next frame after BIS_variable is assigned*
["uniqueId", { [hint](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/hint) [str](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/str) [time](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/time); }, nil, nil, { !isNil { BIS_variable } }] [call](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/call) BIS_fnc_runLater;
```

```sqf
*// Hints current game time in the next frame after 5 seconds have passed and BIS_variable is assigned*
["uniqueId", { [hint](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/hint) [str](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/str) [time](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/time); }, 5, "seconds", { ![isNil](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/isNil) { BIS_variable } }] [call](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/call) BIS_fnc_runLater;
```

```sqf
*// Hints current game time in the next frame*
["uniqueId", { [hint](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/hint) [str](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/str) [time](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/time); }] [call](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/call) BIS_fnc_runLater;
```

bis_fnc_aircrafttailhook.name: BIS_fnc_aircraftTailhook
bis_fnc_aircrafttailhook.description:
/*
	Author: Bravo Zero One development
	- John_Spartan

	Description:
	Aircrfat carrier arrest/recovery function for USS Freedom aircraft carrier

	Exucution:
	Call the function via user-action or script for any compatible fixed wing aircrfat
	[this] spawn bis_fnc_aircraftTailhook;

	Requirments:
	- Compatible aircrfat must have an animation for arrest/tail hook selection defined in CfgCehicles and modeled in 3D model (model.cfg)
	- Compatible aircrfat must have a memory point for cable attach position

	example of cfgVehicles subclass definitions;

		tailHook = true;										Allow to land on carrier
		class CarrierOpsCompatability
		{
			ArrestHookAnimationList[] = {"tailhook", "tailhook_door_l", "tailhook_door_r"};		List of animation played to animate tailhook. Defined in model.cfg (type user)
			ArrestHookAnimationStates[] = {0,0.53,1};						Tailhook animation states when down, hooked, up.
			ArrestHookMemoryPoint = "pos_tailhook";							TailHook memory point in plane model.p3d
			ArrestMaxAllowedSpeed = 275;								Max speed km/h allowed for successful landing
			ArrestSlowDownStep = 0.8;								Simulation step for calcualting how smooth plane will be slowed down.
			ArrestVelocityReduction = -12;								Speed reduced per simulation step

		};

	Parameter(s):
		_this select 0: mode (Scalar)
		0: plane/object


	Returns: nothing
	Result: Aircrfat after touch down on carrier deck will be dynamicly slowed down. If speed willbe above 275 km/h (suggested and configured on vanilla assets) wire snap will be simulated.
		Aircrfat will come to full stop in 155-175 m

*/

#define EXIT_CODE		{_plane animate [_x,_planeHookUpAnimState];} forEach _planeHookAnimList;_plane SetUserMFDvalue [0,0];

> 🏗Placeholder description extracted from the function header by [BIS_fnc_exportFunctionsToWiki](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/BIS_fnc_exportFunctionsToWiki).

sound: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - sound name
forced: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - (Optional, default [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false))

bis_fnc_modulefriendlyfire.name: BIS_fnc_moduleFriendlyFire
bis_fnc_modulefriendlyfire.description:
/*******************************************************************************
	Version:			2.0
	Name:				Friendly Fire
	Author:				Zozo
	DESCRIPTION:	Handles the friendly fire. Use either the module interface in the editor, or call individual functions.
	PARAMETERS:		1) function called - string, list of functions:
				- Init
				- Destroy
				- AddUnits
				- RemoveUnits
				- ChangePriority
				- ListActiveUnit
				2) parameter for the function
	RETURNED VALUE:	depends on the function called
        EXAMPLES:
				// Initializes the module if not added in editor
				// No units are directly checked for friendly fire, but renegade state is checked anyway
				_ret = [ "Init", [] ] call BIS_fnc_moduleFriendlyFire

				// Initializes the module if not added in editor
				// BIS_vip1, BIS_vip2, BIS_noVip units are directly checked for friendly fire
				x = [ "Init", [ [ BIS_vip1, BIS_vip2, BIS_noVip],true ] ] call BIS_fnc_moduleFriendlyFire

				// De-initializes the module
				_ret = [ "Destroy" ] call BIS_fnc_moduleFriendlyFire

				// Add BIS_vip3 unit to be checked for friendly fire
				x = [ "AddUnits", [ [BIS_vip3] ] ] call BIS_fnc_moduleFriendlyFire

				// Remove BIS_vip1 unit from active units
				x = [ "RemoveUnits", [ [ BIS_vip1 ] ] ] call BIS_fnc_moduleFriendlyFire

				// set another priority for a vehicle- if it is hit once, considered as friendly fire
				x = [ "ChangePriority",  [BIS_vip,1] ] call BIS_fnc_moduleFriendlyFire

*******************************************************************************/
> 🏗Placeholder description extracted from the function header by [BIS_fnc_exportFunctionsToWiki](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/BIS_fnc_exportFunctionsToWiki).

syntaxArray.Params:
target: [Position](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Position), [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) or [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Target position, can be object, position or marker name
mag: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - (Optional, default "Sh_82mm_AMOS") magazine (if left empty, first available magazine will be used)
radius: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - (Optional, default 100) radius of target area in meters
rounds: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - (Optional, default 10) number of rounds to be fired
delay: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) or [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - (Optional, default 10) delay between rounds

* [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) [min, max]:

* min: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - min delay

* max: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - max delay

* [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Precise delay
conditionEnd: [Code](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Code) - (Optional, default 
```sqf
{ [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false) }
```
) Condition to end bombardment before all rounds are fired
safezone: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - (Optional, default 0) Safezone radius - minimal distance from the target position where shells may be directed at
alt: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - (Optional, default 250) Altitude where the shell will be created
speed: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - (Optional, default 150) Descending velocity, in m/s. Default is 150, if you use flare as ammo, set it to lower value (1-5) to let it fall down slowly
sounds: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) of [strings](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - (Optional, default [""]) Sounds to be played on the incoming shell

bis_fnc_fadeeffect.name: BIS_fnc_fadeEffect
bis_fnc_fadeeffect.description: Easily carry out complex fading. Default values will be used if parameters are not defined or set to nil.

syntaxArray.Syntax: [*fadeInOrOut, blackOrWhite, duration, blur, music, ending, success*] spawn BIS_fnc_fadeEffect
syntaxArray.Params:
fadeInOrOut: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - (Optional, default 1) 0 to fade out, 1 to fade in
fadeColor: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - (Optional, default "BLACK") **case-sensitive** can be "BLACK" or "WHITE"
duration: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - (Optional, default 3) fade duration in seconds
blur: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - (Optional, default 0) 0 to not blur, 1 to blur (blur-in for fade-in, blur-out for fade-out)
music: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - (Optional, default "") **only for fade-out** music class name defined in [CfgMusic](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Description.ext#CfgMusic)
ending: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - (Optional, default "") "" to not end the mission, else a value compatible with [endMission](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/endMission) or [failMission](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/failMission). **Will end mission only for the local player**
success: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - (Optional, default 1) **if *ending* != ""** 1 to end mission with success, 0 to fail mission

bis_fnc_logformatserver.name: BIS_fnc_logFormatServer

Logs (using [diag_log](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/diag_log)) a debug message ([profileName](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/profileName), [playerUID](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/getPlayerUID), [_fnc_scriptName](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Magic_Variables#fnc_scriptName), provided text) to **server**'s [.RPT](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Crash_Files). In singleplayer, [BIS_fnc_logFormat](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/BIS_fnc_logFormat) is used.
> ⓘ[allowFunctionsLog](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Description.ext#allowFunctionsLog) must be enabled.

syntaxArray.Params:
text: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) or [Anything](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Anything) - text using [format](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/format) standard (with %). Any non-[String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) value will be converted (with [str](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/str))
argument1..n: [Anything](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Anything) - same as [format](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/format) arguments - referenced in *text* as %1, %2 etc

bis_fnc_prepareao.name: BIS_fnc_prepareAO
bis_fnc_prepareao.description:
Spawns random patrols and/or vehicles in trigger areas with proper names. Side selected in the triggers "Activation" listbox will determine the side of the spawned asset(s).

Trigger **names** (a.k.a "Trigger text", **not** "Variable Name") defines the kind of spawn. Supported trigger names are:

* **GEN_infantry**: spawns random infantry patrol with sentry waypoints (**NOTE:** only circular triggers are supported, min. axis should be 500m)

* **GEN_patrolVeh**: spawns a random vehicle. If a civilian unit is synchronized with the trigger, its waypoint will be used by the spawned vehicleYou can specify the vehicle type by typing one of the following into the trigger's "On Act." field:

* car

* apc

* tank

* **GEN_ammo**: spawns a random number of ammoboxes. You can get and idea of the shape this composition will have by making this trigger rectangular with dimensions 5m x 1m. You can also specify the amount of crates spawned by using min. and max. Timeout values (supported range is 1 to 6 crates).

* **GEN_civilCar**: spawns a random empty civil car

syntaxArray.Params: density: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - (Optional, default 1) enemy presence density index used for random footpatrols

bis_fnc_setunitinsignia.name: BIS_fnc_setUnitInsignia
bis_fnc_setunitinsignia.description: Sets unit insignia (e.g., shoulder insignia on soldiers). See [Arma 3: Unit Insignia](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3:_Unit_Insignia) for more details and a list of official insignias.

syntaxArray.Params:
target: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - unit to which the insignia is going to be attached
class: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - CfgUnitInsignia class name to use. Use an empty string to remove the current insignia.

examples:
Place insignia: 
```sqf
[[player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player), "111thID"] [call](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/call) BIS_fnc_setUnitInsignia;
```
Remove insignia: 
```sqf
[[player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player), ""] [call](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/call) BIS_fnc_setUnitInsignia;
```

bis_fnc_bitwiseor.name: BIS_fnc_bitwiseOR
bis_fnc_bitwiseor.description:
Performs bitwise OR operation on two decimal or hexadecimal unsigned 24 bit integers (Hexadecimal number representation is simply auto-converted into decimal by the engine)
**Limitations**:
Due to various limitations of the Real Virtuality engine this function is 
intended to work with unsigned 24 bit integers only. This means that the 
supported range is 2^0...2^24 (1...16777216)

syntaxArray.Params:
num1: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - decimal or hexadecimal unsigned 24 bit integer
num2: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - decimal or hexadecimal unsigned 24 bit integer

bis_fnc_importimagelinks.name: BIS_fnc_importImageLinks
bis_fnc_importimagelinks.description:
Imports CfgVehicles image links from Community Wiki ([https://community.bistudio.com/](https://community.bistudio.comhttps://community.bistudio.com/)).

* Run the script. It will copy a text into clipboard

* Open your [Sandbox](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Special:MyPage/Sandbox) and paste the text into edit field

* **Preview** the page (don't save it)

* Copy the resulting text and use it in your scripts

Result is to the following format:

```sqf
_imagesCfgVehicles = [
	"papercar","[https://community.bistudio.com/wikidata/images/8/85/Arma3_CfgVehicles_PaperCar.jpg](https://community.bistudio.comhttps://community.bistudio.com/wikidata/images/8/85/Arma3_CfgVehicles_PaperCar.jpg)",
	"firesectortarget","",
	"building","",
	(…)
];
```


> ⚠Be wary that **this function is CPU-demanding** and may lock your computer for 5-10 seconds!

bis_fnc_loop.name: BIS_fnc_loop
bis_fnc_loop.description: Loop stacked code/function with timing and conditional control. Code and conditions are executed in [non-scheduled environment](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Scheduler#Unscheduled_Environment).

syntaxArray.Params:
action: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - can be one of:

* "initialize" - Initializes game loop (not required as internal AUTO_INITIALIZE variable is set to true)

* "terminate" - Terminates game loop (required as internal AUTO_TERMINATE variable is *not* set to true)

* "itemAdd" - Adds an item to loop

* "itemRemove" - Remove item from loop with id "uniqueId"

* *"onEachFrame" - internally used by "initialize"*

* *"itemExecute" - internally used by "onEachFrame"*
parameters: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - used with "itemAdd" and "itemRemove" *action* ("itemRemove" only takes id):

* id: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - loop unique id

* code: [Code](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Code) or [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - code to be executed

* timer: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - (Optional, default 0) delay between executions

* timerType: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - (Optional, default "seconds") can be "seconds" or "frames"

* conditionStart: [Code](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Code) - (Optional, default 
```sqf
{ [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) }
```
) will *wait* until the condition is met to start the code

* conditionEnd:  [Code](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Code) - (Optional, default 
```sqf
{ [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false) }
```
) stops the loop as soon as the ending condition is met (after the end of *code*)

* executeOnce: [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - (Optional, default [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false))

examples:
```sqf
*// hints time every five seconds*
["itemAdd", ["uniqueId", { hint str time; }, 5]] [call](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/call) BIS_fnc_loop;
```

```sqf
*// removes stacked loop with id of uniqueId*
["itemRemove", ["uniqueId"]] [call](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/call) BIS_fnc_loop;
```

```sqf
*// hints time every frame after BIS_variable is assigned*
["itemAdd", ["uniqueId", { [hint](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/hint) [str](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/str) [time](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/time); }, [nil](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/nil), [nil](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/nil), { ![isNil](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/isNil) { BIS_variable } }]] [call](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/call) BIS_fnc_loop;
```

```sqf
*// hints time every five seconds after BIS_variable is assigned*
["itemAdd", ["uniqueId", { [hint](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/hint) [str](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/str) [time](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/time); }, 5, "seconds", { ![isNil](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/isNil) { BIS_variable } }]] [call](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/call) BIS_fnc_loop;
```

```sqf
*// hints time every frame*
["itemAdd", ["uniqueId", { [hint](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/hint) [str](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/str) [time](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/time); }]] [call](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/call) BIS_fnc_loop;
```

```sqf
*// remove item from loop with id "uniqueId"*
["itemRemove", ["uniqueId"]] [call](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/call) BIS_fnc_loop;
```

bis_fnc_easein.name: BIS_fnc_easeIn

syntaxArray.Params:
a: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - (Optional, default 0) First point (start)
b: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - (Optional, default 0) Second point (end)
alpha: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - (Optional, default 0) Original interpolation speed
exp: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - (Optional, default 2) Power applied to alpha

examples:
```sqf
[] [call](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/call) BIS_fnc_easeIn; *// returns 0*
```

```sqf
[0, 2, 0.5] [call](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/call) BIS_fnc_easeIn; *// returns 0.5*
```

```sqf
([0, 2, 0.5] [call](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/call) [BIS_fnc_lerp](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/BIS_fnc_lerp)) [==](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/a_%3D%3D_b) ([0, 2, 0.5, 1] [call](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/call) BIS_fnc_easeIn) *// returns [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true)*
```

bis_fnc_getpitchbank.name: BIS_fnc_getPitchBank
bis_fnc_getpitchbank.description:
Returns the pitch and bank of an object, in degrees. **Yaw** can be found using the [getDir](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/getDir) command.
**Pitch** is 0 when the object is level; 90 when pointing straight up; and -90 when pointing straight down.
**Bank** is 0 when level; 90 when the object is rolled to the right, -90 when rolled to the left, and 180 when rolled upside down.

> ⚠The **bank** returned by this command is not fully accurate, it can be off by up to 5% or so (depending on pitch) due to an unknown bug.

syntaxArray.Params: object: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object)

bis_fnc_nearestposition.name: BIS_fnc_nearestPosition
bis_fnc_nearestposition.description: Function to find the nearest Object or position from a list, when compared to a given reference.

syntaxArray.Params:
items: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) of [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object), [Location](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Location), [Group](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Group), [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) (marker) **and/or** [Position](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Position) - note that for a group, **leader's position** is used
origin: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object), [Location](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Location), [Group](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Group), [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) (marker) or [Position](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Position)

examples:
```sqf
*// Find the nearest marker from player*
_nearestMarker = [[allMapMarkers](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/allMapMarkers), [player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player)] [call](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/call) BIS_fnc_nearestPosition;
```

```sqf
*// Find the nearest marker to trigger using trigger onActivation code*
_nearestMarker = [[allMapMarkers](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/allMapMarkers), [thisTrigger](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/thisTrigger)] [call](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/call) BIS_fnc_nearestPosition;
```

bis_fnc_dynamicgroups.name: BIS_fnc_dynamicGroups
bis_fnc_dynamicgroups.description: Function that adds dynamic groups to the mission as seen in End Game. Function needs to be initialized on server and client. Clients can then use action TeamSwitch ("U" by default) to access the Dynamic Groups interface.

syntaxArray.Params:
mode: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Mode, can be:

* "Initialize" - Initializes dynamic groups on the server

* "Terminate" - Terminates dynamic groups on the server

* "InitializePlayer" - Does client side initialization

* "TerminatePlayer" - Does client side termination

* "IsInitialized" - Checks whether dynamic groups was initialized

* "RegisterGroup" - Registers a group

* "UnregisterGroup" - Unregisters a group

* "IsGroupRegistered" - Whether a group was already registered or not

* "SetName" - Sets the name of the group, in future, will also update GroupId of the group

* "SetPrivateState" - Set the private state of a group

* "SwitchLeader" - Switches the leader of given group to the given player

* "AddGroupMember" - Add a group member to group

* "RemoveGroupMember" - Switches a player from one group to another

* "KickPlayer" - Kicks a player from group, player wont be able to join the group unless invited or is unkicked using UnKickPlayer

* "UnKickPlayer" - Unkicks a player from a group

* "WasPlayerKickedFrom" - Whether given player was kicked from given group

* "GetAllGroups" - Returns all registered and valid groups
params: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - Parameter changes according to mode. Check the function in the Functions Viewer for detailed information

examples:
```sqf
["Initialize"] [call](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/call) BIS_fnc_dynamicGroups;//Exec on Server
```

```sqf
["InitializePlayer", [[player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player)]] [call](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/call) BIS_fnc_dynamicGroups;//Exec on client
```

bis_fnc_initinspectable.name: BIS_fnc_initInspectable
bis_fnc_initinspectable.description: Initialize inspectable object: add "Inspect" action to the object. When a player activates it, full-screen detail of the objects is shown.

syntaxArray.Params:
inspectable: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - object on which the action is added
textureInfos: can be one of the following:

* [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - texture path

* [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - [texture, index, aspectRatio]:

* texture: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - texture path

* index: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - (Optional, default 0) index on which the texture will be mapped on the object using setObjectTexture. Use -1 to ignore.

* aspectRatio: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - (Optional, default -1) texture aspect ratio. 0.5 means width will be 0.5 of the height. -1 means texture default.

* [Boolean](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true) to instantly show the *inspectable* full-screen preview (**following params are then ignored**)
fullScreenText: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - text to be shown after clicking on READ button. Ideally localized.
soundName: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - sound played when entering full-screen preview. Sould be defined in [CfgSounds](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Description.ext#CfgSounds).

examples:
```sqf
[myLeaflet, "#(argb,8,8,3)color(1,0,1,1)", "This is some Magic Pink"] [call](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/call) BIS_fnc_initInspectable; *// Initialize*
```

```sqf
[myLeaflet, [true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true)] [call](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/call) [BIS_fnc_initLeaflet](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/BIS_fnc_initLeaflet); *// Show preview instantly*
```

bis_fnc_exportcfgvehiclesassetdb.name: BIS_fnc_exportCfgVehiclesAssetDB
bis_fnc_exportcfgvehiclesassetdb.description: Copies [CfgVehicles](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:CfgVehicles) information to clipboard in wiki format.

syntaxArray.Params:
side: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) or [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - (default: 
```sqf
[4,5,6,7,8,9]
```
) can be:




* 0: OPFOR / CSAT

* 1: BLUFOR / NATO

* 2: Independent / Guerrilla

* 3: Civilian

* 4: Unknown



* 5: Enemy

* 6: Friendly

* 7: Logic

* 8: Empty

* 9: AmbientLife

see [side](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/side).
category: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - (Optional, default 0 if *side* is a number, always reverts to 1 if *side* an array) only used when *side* is set to **3**.
Can be one of the following:




* 0: civilian units

* 1: structures

* 2: ruins and wrecks

* 3: equipment



* 4: objects

* 5: VR

* 6: animals

examples:
```sqf
[0]   [spawn](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/spawn) BIS_fnc_exportCfgVehiclesAssetDB;	*// exports [Arma 3 CfgVehicles EAST](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3_CfgVehicles_EAST)*
[1]   [spawn](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/spawn) BIS_fnc_exportCfgVehiclesAssetDB;	*// exports [Arma 3 CfgVehicles WEST](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3_CfgVehicles_WEST)*
[2]   [spawn](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/spawn) BIS_fnc_exportCfgVehiclesAssetDB;	*// exports [Arma 3 CfgVehicles GUER](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3_CfgVehicles_GUER)*
[3,0] [spawn](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/spawn) BIS_fnc_exportCfgVehiclesAssetDB;	*// exports [Arma 3 CfgVehicles CIV](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3_CfgVehicles_CIV)*
[3,1] [spawn](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/spawn) BIS_fnc_exportCfgVehiclesAssetDB;	*// exports [Arma 3 CfgVehicles Structures](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3_CfgVehicles_Structures)*
[3,2] [spawn](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/spawn) BIS_fnc_exportCfgVehiclesAssetDB;	*// exports [Arma 3 CfgVehicles Ruins & Wrecks](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3_CfgVehicles_Ruins_%26_Wrecks)*
[3,3] [spawn](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/spawn) BIS_fnc_exportCfgVehiclesAssetDB;	*// exports [Arma 3 CfgVehicles Equipment](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3_CfgVehicles_Equipment)*
[3,4] [spawn](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/spawn) BIS_fnc_exportCfgVehiclesAssetDB;	*// exports [Arma 3 CfgVehicles EMPTY](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3_CfgVehicles_EMPTY)*
[3,5] [spawn](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/spawn) BIS_fnc_exportCfgVehiclesAssetDB;	*// exports [Arma 3 CfgVehicles VR Objects](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3_CfgVehicles_VR_Objects)*
[3,6] [spawn](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/spawn) BIS_fnc_exportCfgVehiclesAssetDB;	*// exports [Arma 3 CfgVehicles Animals](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3_CfgVehicles_Animals)*
[]    [spawn](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/spawn) BIS_fnc_exportCfgVehiclesAssetDB;	*// exports [Arma 3 CfgVehicles Other](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3_CfgVehicles_Other):*
												*// Unknown, Enemy, Friendly, Modules, Empty, Ambient Life*
```

Creates particle sandstorm round given object. > [](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Arma_3)**newspapers** parameter is disabled in Arma 3 
> ```sqf
> if (_newspapers && false)...
> ```
>

bis_fnc_exportcfgweapons.name: BIS_fnc_exportCfgWeapons
bis_fnc_exportcfgweapons.description: Export list of weapons for Community Wiki [Arma 3 Assets Category](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Arma_3:_Assets).

syntaxArray.Params:
mode: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - can be one of:

* "Equipment"

* "Item"

* "VehicleWeapon"

* "Weapon" - specific item type, based on [BIS_fnc_itemType](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/BIS_fnc_itemType)

* internal use only: "screenshots" - create items one by one and take their screenshot. Works only on "Render" terrain.

* internal use only: "screenshotsTest" - create items one by one without taking screen (to verify everything is ok)
patches: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) of [Strings](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - (Optional, default 
```sqf
[]
```
) list of [CfgPatches](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/CfgPatches) classes. Only weapons belonging to these addons will be used
types: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) of [Strings](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - (Optional, default 
```sqf
[]
```
)

examples:
```sqf
         ["Weapon"] [spawn](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/spawn) BIS_fnc_exportCfgWeapons;	*// exports [Arma 3 CfgWeapons Weapons](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3_CfgWeapons_Weapons)*
  ["VehicleWeapon"] [spawn](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/spawn) BIS_fnc_exportCfgWeapons;	*// exports [Arma 3 CfgWeapons Vehicle Weapons](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3_CfgWeapons_Vehicle_Weapons)*

      ["Equipment"] [spawn](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/spawn) BIS_fnc_exportCfgWeapons;	*// exports [Arma 3 CfgWeapons Equipment](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Arma_3_CfgWeapons_Equipment)*
    ["screenshots"] [spawn](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/spawn) BIS_fnc_exportCfgWeapons;	*// exports screenshots*
["screenshotsTest"] [spawn](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/spawn) BIS_fnc_exportCfgWeapons;	*// screenshots test mode, does nothing*
```

bis_fnc_supplydrop.name: BIS_fnc_supplydrop
bis_fnc_supplydrop.description: Script for para-drop of objects. Spawns waitUntil that handles ground hit (detaching of object from parachute). Used by supplydrop service.

syntaxArray.Params:
airUnit: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - Air Unit

* "land": Drops a car appropriate to airUnit's side

bis_fnc_dirindicator.name: BIS_fnc_dirIndicator
bis_fnc_dirindicator.description:
Show a 4-directions indicator.
Indicator GUI layer is 17, its [Display](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Display) is accessible with 
```sqf
[uiNamespace](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/uiNamespace) [getVariable](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/getVariable) "BIS_RscMissionScreen_dirIndicator"
```
.
Can be reexecuted to change its colour, but once executed this function **cannot** be halted until *origin*'s death.

syntaxArray.Params:
origin: [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - origin, usually [player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player)
target: [Code](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Code), [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String), [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) or [Position](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Position) - to which indicator points to:

* [Code](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Code) - code result must be [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) or [Position](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Position)

* [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - [missionNamespace](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/missionNamespace) variable name

* [Object](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Object) - any object

* [Position](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Position) - any position
color: [Color (RGBA)](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Color) - (Optional, default [0.424,0.651,0.247,1] (Arma 2 green))
sizeCoef: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - (Optional, default 0.1045752 (command bar height)) size coefficient

bis_fnc_destroyer01playhangardoorsound.name: BIS_fnc_destroyer01PlayHangarDoorSound
bis_fnc_destroyer01playhangardoorsound.description:
/*
	Author: Bravo Zero One development
	- John_Spartan

	Description:
	- This is a sub function designed to add sounds required for ship hangar door animation.

	Execution:
	- Call from main script that handles the hangar door animation.

		Example:
		[_shipPart, _soundPos, _animationState] spawn bis_fnc_destroyer01PlayHangarDoorSound;

	Parameter(s):
		_this select 0: mode (Scalar)
		0: ship-part object
		and
		1: position in word coordinates where the sound should be played (modelToWorldWorld)
		2: animation state of hangar doors


	Returns: nothing
	Result: Ship's hangar door animation gets a sound source added.

*/> 🏗Placeholder description extracted from the function header by [BIS_fnc_exportFunctionsToWiki](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/BIS_fnc_exportFunctionsToWiki).

bis_fnc_displaycolorget.name: BIS_fnc_displayColorGet
bis_fnc_displaycolorget.description:
Loads custom [color settings](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/User_Interface_Colors) from CfgUIDefault.

If variables are not stored in [profileNamespace](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/profileNamespace) yet, the function will declare them.





Arma 3 v1.99


Tag
Variable
Description


"IGUI"

Backgrounds

Active Elements

Warnings

Errors


"TACTPING_RGB"
Tactical Ping


"GUI"

"BCG_RGB"
Backgrounds


"TITLETEXT_RGB"
Title Text


"Map"

"BLUFOR"
BLUFOR


"OPFOR"
OPFOR


"Independent"
Independent


"Civilian"
Civilian


"Unknown"
Unknown


"Subtitles"

Subtitle text




Take On Helicopters v1.00


Tag
Variable
Description

HUD color **RGB**

menu background **RGB**

bis_fnc_exp_camp_guidedprojectile.name: BIS_fnc_EXP_camp_guidedProjectile
bis_fnc_exp_camp_guidedprojectile.description:
/*
	Author: Nelson Duarte

	Description:
	Spawns object of given class and makes it travel, hooming towards the target
	To be used with CfgAmmo type of entity, but can be used with virtually any kind of object

	Parameters:
		_startPos: 		ARRAY 			The initial position of the projectile (ASL)
		_class: 		STRING or OBJECT	The class name of the object to spawn or an object entity already existing
		_target:		OBJECT			The target object the projectile will be hooming towards to
		_speed:			SCALAR			The speed the object should assume
		_destroyTarget:		BOOL			Whether to force destruction of the target object on detonation
		_localOffset:		ARRAY			The model space position offset that projectile should be hooming towards to
		_minDistanceToTarget:	SCALAR			The minimal distance projectile needs to be from target position to enter ballistic mode
		_function		STRING			The function to execute on the created object with params [<object>]
		_isGlobalFunction	BOOL			Whether the executed function should be executed on all connected machine, false to execute only on the server

	Returns:
		NOTHING
*/> 🏗Placeholder description extracted from the function header by [BIS_fnc_exportFunctionsToWiki](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/BIS_fnc_exportFunctionsToWiki).

bis_fnc_limititems.description: Keeps or removes unit's items (including NVGs and binocular/designator) based on probability user sets.

chanceNVG: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - (Optional, default 50) - Chance to keep NVG in %

* 0 = Item is always removed

* 100 = Item is always kept
chanceBino: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - (Optional, default 50) - Chance to keep binoculars in %
chanceGPS: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - (Optional, default 50) - Chance to keep GPS in %
chanceMap: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - (Optional, default 50) - Chance to keep Map in %
chanceRadio: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - (Optional, default 50) - Chance to keep radio in %
chanceCompass: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - (Optional, default 50) - Chance to keep compass in %
chanceWatch: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - (Optional, default 50) - Chance to keep watch in %

bis_fnc_modulechat.name: BIS_fnc_moduleChat
bis_fnc_modulechat.description: Make a list of units use any *chat command ([groupChat](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/groupChat), [vehicleChat](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/vehicleChat), [sideChat](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/sideChat), [commandChat](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/commandChat), [globalChat](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/globalChat)).

syntaxArray.Syntax: [target, IDType, size, type, side, name, shortName, texture, textSizeCoef, insignia, textColour, commName, commRank, description, assets] call BIS_fnc_ORBATSetGroupParams
syntaxArray.Params:
target: [Config](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Config) - Path to class in CfgORBAT
IDType: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) or [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - IDType (e.g., 1 to result in "1st", or a specific string)
size: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Size as a class from CfgChainOfCommand > Sizes (e.g., "Platoon")
type: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Type as a class from CfgChainOfCommand > Types (e.g., "Infantry")
side: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Side as a class from CfgChainOfCommand > Sides (e.g., "West")
name: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Name. Passed arguments are: %1 - ID, %2 - type, %3 - size)
shortName: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Short name. Passed arguments are: %1 - ID, %2 - type, %3 - size)
texture: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Texture. Can be link to a file or a class from CfgMarkers
textSizeCoef: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Texture size coeficient. 1 is the default size
insignia: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Insignia displayed in tooltip and in the ORBAT viewer background
textColour: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - Texture color in format RGBA
commName: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Commander name. Can be the name directly or a class from CfgWorlds > GenericNames
commRank: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Commander rank
description: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Description shown in tooltip
assets: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) of [arrays](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) in format:

* vehicleClass: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - Vehicle class name

* count: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - Quantity of vehicles

bis_fnc_exporteditorpreviews.name: BIS_fnc_exportEditorPreviews
bis_fnc_exporteditorpreviews.description:
Export screeenshots of objects for [Eden Editor](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Eden_Editor) and Community Wiki to 
```sqf
<Arma 3 Profile>\Screenshots\EditorPreviews
```
 directory.
See [Arma 3 assets](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Arma_3:_Assets).

The file is saved into *Screenshots* folder in the [Profile](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Profile) directory. The folder is by default limited to 250 MB to prevent abuse.

To increase the limit, add the following line at the end of the profile file:

```sqf
maxScreenShotFolderSizeMB = 2000;
```

2000 can be replaced by any value in MB.

syntaxArray.Syntax: [duration, type, sides, mods, addons] spawn BIS_fnc_exportEditorPreviews
syntaxArray.Params:
duration: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - (Optional, default 1) duration in seconds for which an objects remains on the screen before its screen is captured
type: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - (Optional, default "all") can be one of:

* "vehicles" - only characters and vehicles will be used

* "props" - only props will be used

* "all" - all objects will be used
sides: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) of [Sides](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Side) - (Optional, default all sides) list of sides. Only objects of these sides will be used
mods: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) of [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - (Optional, default all mods) list of CfgMods classes. Only objects belonging to these mods will be used
addons: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) of [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - (Optional, default all addons) list of CfgPatches classes. Only objects belonging to these addons will be used
classes: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) of [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - (Optional, default all classes) list of CfgVehicles classes. Only these objects will be used

examples:
```sqf
*// All objects*
[] [spawn](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/spawn) BIS_fnc_exportEditorPreviews;
```

```sqf
*// All characters and vehicles. Capturing delay will be 0.5 seconds*
[0.5, "vehicles"] [spawn](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/spawn) BIS_fnc_exportEditorPreviews;
```

```sqf
*// BLUFOR characters and vehicles*
[[nil](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/nil), "vehicles", [[west](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/west)]] [spawn](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/spawn) BIS_fnc_exportEditorPreviews;
```

```sqf
*// Props in Karts DLC*
[[nil](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/nil), "props", [], ["kart"]] [spawn](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/spawn) BIS_fnc_exportEditorPreviews;
```

```sqf
*// All objects in specified addons*
[[nil](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/nil), "all", [], [], ["A3_Armor_F_Slammer", "A3_Air_F_Heli_Heli_Transport_03"]] [spawn](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/spawn) BIS_fnc_exportEditorPreviews;
```

```sqf
*// BLUFOR characters and vehicles in Marksmen DLC*
[[nil](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/nil), "vehicles", [[west](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/west)], ["mark"]] [spawn](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/spawn) BIS_fnc_exportEditorPreviews;
```

```sqf
*// Only the B_Soldier_F*
[[nil](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/nil), "all", [], [], [], ["B_Soldier_F"]] [spawn](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/spawn) BIS_fnc_exportEditorPreviews;
```

bis_fnc_scaleandtranslate.name: BIS_fnc_scaleAndTranslate
bis_fnc_scaleandtranslate.description:
/*
	Author: Riccardo Argiolas

	Description:
    	Translates and scales (with pivot) and fades a picture over time.

	Parameters:
	Select 0 - CONTROL: picture that has to be modified
	Select 1 - NUMBER: how much the picture has to be scaled (>1 makes it bigger, 1 keeps it the same, <1 makes it smaller)
	Select 2 - STRING: select the pivot's position (i.e. center of the scaling process)
	Select 3 - ARRAY: how much the picture has to be translated/moved in [X,Y] format
	Select 4 - NUMBER: either the duration of the animation(default) or the speed of the translation, depending on what the next parameter is set to.
	Select 5 - BOOL: true = duration will be used, false = speed will be used.
	Select 6 - NUMBER: transparency of the image at the end of the animation (1 = invisible)

	Returns: 
	NUMBER: Duration of the animation. (Useful for determining how much sleep time is needed between animations)

	Examples:
	[_controlFront, 0.8, "topLeft"] call BIS_fnc_scaleAndTranslate;
	_t = [_controlFront, 1, "bottomRight", [0.1, 0.1], 0.5, false] call BIS_fnc_scaleAndTranslate;
	sleep (_t * 2);
	[_controlFront, 0.8, "topRight", [0.5, 0.3]] call BIS_fnc_scaleAndTranslate;
*/> 🏗Placeholder description extracted from the function header by [BIS_fnc_exportFunctionsToWiki](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/BIS_fnc_exportFunctionsToWiki).

bis_fnc_configextremes.name: BIS_fnc_configExtremes
bis_fnc_configextremes.description:
Scan config paths and return min and max values for each property.
Can be used only for properties of type [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) and [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) (value is considered to be the geometric mean of all numbers in the array).

syntaxArray.Params:
paths: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) of [Configs](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Config) - paths to be scanned.
properties: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) of [Strings](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - class names of properties to be evaluated.
propertyTypes (Optional): [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) of [Booleans](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Boolean) - whether the property at the respective index should be evaluated and returned as a [logarithmic](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/log) number. Default: [false](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/false)
propertyDefaults (Optional): [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) of [Numbers](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number) - value to be used in cases where the property at the respective index is not defined. Default: 0
syntaxArray.Return: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - [minValues, maxValues] where minValues and maxValues are arrays respective to the properties array.

bis_fnc_conditionalselect.name: BIS_fnc_conditionalSelect
bis_fnc_conditionalselect.description:
This returns a sub-array of elements that satisfy a specific condition **in the order they have been passed**.
> [](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Category:Arma_3)use 
> ```sqf
> *items* [select](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/select) *condition*
> ```
>  syntax instead (since Arma 3 v1.55
In the condition, the currently tested element is assigned to the variable "[_x](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Magic_Variables#x)".

The original array is **not** modified.

syntaxArray.Params:
items: [Array](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Array) - array to check
condition: [Code](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Code) - selection code

examples:
```sqf
[[10,0,8,2,6,4], { [_x](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Magic_Variables#x) > 5 }] [call](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/call) BIS_fnc_conditionalSelect; // will return [10,8,6]
```

```sqf
[[10,[true](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/true),8,[player](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/player)], { [typeName](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/typeName) _x == "STRING" }] [call](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/call) BIS_fnc_conditionalSelect; // will return []
```

bis_fnc_posdegtoworld.name: BIS_fnc_posDegToWorld
bis_fnc_posdegtoworld.description:
Convert latitude/longtitude coordinates into game world position.
World config **must** contain following settings to convert the position correctly:

```sqf
*// Required for scripting*
mapSize = 61440;	*// Can differ from mapArea size, as ingame world can be resized*
mapZone = 10;		*// UTM zone*
mapArea[] = {		*// lon/lat coordinates (not in UTM to assure .kml precision)*
	-122.754367782585,47.3272454065969,	*// Bottom Left*
	-121.930117859276,47.8753494907418	*// Top Right*
};
```

syntaxArray.Params:
longitude: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number)
latitude: [Number](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/Number)
world: [String](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/String) - (Optional, default [worldName](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/worldName))

bis_fnc_diagmacrossimpleobject.name: BIS_fnc_diagMacrosSimpleObject
bis_fnc_diagmacrossimpleobject.description:
/*
	Generates simple object config data.

	Parameters:
		0: OBJECT or ARRAY - ground position where ground objects will be created (default: position calculated 15 meters away from player)
		1: SCALAR or BOOL - autolog mode (default: false)
			0 or false - no autolog, results will be only stored in clipboard
			1 or true - autolog on, results will be stored in \A3\macros_CfgVehicles_simpleObject_auto_A3.hpp file.
			2 - autlog on + world name, random number and custom suffix are appended to name of generated file to prevent overwriting and provide extra info
		2: ARRAY - classes you want to scan, use [] to scan all (default: []).
		3: OBJECT or ARRAY - sea position where ground objects will be created (default: position calculated 15 meters away from player)
		4: STRING - custom suffix added to filename if autolog is used (default: "").


	Example:
	bis_scriptHandle = [] spawn bis_fnc_diagMacrosSimpleObject;

	Expected output per class (animate and hide arrays can have varying amount of elements):
	#define CFGVEHICLES_SIMPLEOBJECT_class_F\
		class SimpleObject\
		{\
			animate[] =\
			{\
				{"animationName1", 1},\
				{"animationName2", 2}\
			};\
			hide[] =\
			{\
				"animationSelection1",\
				"animationSelection2"\
			};\
			verticalOffsetAsl = 0;\
		};
*/> 🏗Placeholder description extracted from the function header by [BIS_fnc_exportFunctionsToWiki](https://community.bistudio.com/wiki/BIS_fnc_exportFunctionsToWiki).
